prefix: <|prompter|>How can I remove popcorn ceiling?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>How can I remove popcorn ceiling?
<|assistant|>
suffix: Popcorn ceilings are a type of common industrial ceiling that were very popular in the earlier part of the twentieth century. Although they are still in wide circulation, many modern properties are converting these ceilings into more aesthetically pleasing alternatives. Most mineral wool popcorn ceilings can be safely removed with simple tools and techniques, and there are specialists with established processes and safety protocols that can do this work for you. Installing new ceilings is costly and should be approached as a significant home improvement project, so it's best to plan ahead, research and prepare.

Removing popcorn ceiling is a project that takes time, effort and careful attention, and measures should be taken to ensure that the work is done safely.  
Here are some best practices to consider:
-Safely and completely remove existing popcorn ceiling tiles in your home. The process involves removing screws securing the new tiles to supports, and breaking the surface of the tiles to detach them from the glue. 
-Seal existing holes in walls and ceilings with spackle, joint compound or wallboard compound.
-Fill holes left in the wall and ceiling with caulk or seam material before installing new coat of paint.
-Patch small holes in the wall with drywall, and repair larger ones with plywood panels.
-Install new ceiling with drywall and joint compound, and cover seams, corners and joints with drywall tape and joint compound. 
-Repair cracks and holes in walls with drywall and joint compound. Then apply tape and joint compound to seams and corners.
-Prime and apply new coat of paint to the ceiling, walls and trim to clean and protect repaired areas.

suffix: Rice cereal is produced via a wet milling process, which separates various nutritious components of the rice grain.  In this case, rice cereal is produced through a process of grinding rice kernels, then washing, and centrifuge drying and rolling to produce flakes.  Rice cereal flakes are then used to make various products including breakfast cereals, rice paper, cakes and cookies, as well as various confectionary treats like rice crispy treats. Rice cereal produced from white rice is often ground to finer flakes for use in breakfast cereals, while rice cereal produced from brown rice is ground to coarser flakes for use in simple snacks and baked goods.  Producing rice cereal requires immense amounts of processing and water, so making rice cereal from locally-produced rice in a sustainable way is a key part of sustainable food production.  Rice cereal is often packaged in boxes or bags as a healthy and convenient snack available all year round.

Rice cereal is made from actual cooked rice, ground down a bit to create a more fine, floury consistency.  Harder varieties of rice work best, like Arborio rice used for making risotto, medium-grain rice, or long-grain rice.  The process for making rice cereal generally involves grinding up cooked rice with a large paddle-style seed mill, minus the seed.  The resulting powder can be stored in an airtight container and used to make food and drinks.  Here is a possible recipe for a vegan rice cereal breakfast bar or snack:

prefix: <|prompter|>What are some things that can damage your credit score in the U.S.?

Damaging factors that are likely to harm your credit score can include extended delinquent accounts, new debts, late payments, high credit balances, or risky types of credit offered. Accounts delinquent for multiple months or multiple past due payments have the greatest negative impact.
<|prompter|>And what things can improve your credit score?

<|assistant|>Conscientious use of credit, including making payments on time, responsible management of open and active credit balances, and paying off debt each month where possible can help improve your credit score. Open and active interest-bearing accounts, such as installment loans, bank loans or credit lines, used in the normal course of business can also help raise your credit score. Losing control of credit would be damaging to your credit score, and therefore prone to damaging your credit rating as well.
<|prompter|>What range constitutes a good credit score?

<|assistant|>The typical range in the US is good credit from 700 to 850. prefix: <|prompter|>Why is using computer and TV screens in dark rooms bad for eyes?

<|assistant|>Good question!  There are several potential eye health issues that are related to spending a lot of time looking at computer and TV screens in dark surroundings.  One major issue is increased risk of development of myopia or nearsightedness, which is an abnormal elongation of the eyeball that primarily causes difficulty seeing distant objects clearly.  Studies suggest that the increased use of computers since the 1990’s has caused a major surge in the incidence of myopia around the world, and that this is likely due to the fact that myopia is most commonly developed in children who spend a lot of time looking at close-up objects, which is precisely the case for many computer and TV users.  Another concern is that the glare and bright light from computer and TV screens can damage the retinal cells in the eye, leading to a condition called “digital eye strain”.  Many users of computer and TV screens are also prone to developing dry eye and irritation due to the fact that staring at the screens for extended durations of time depletes the tears in the eyes which keep the eye moist.  All of these issues can generally be alleviated by getting better lighting and increasing breaks away from the screen, but can be particularly exacerbated in dark environments. suffix: It is proposed that near sightedness primarily occurs as a result of excessive screen time due to the fact that children and adults are spending a considerable duration of time looking at close-up objects.  This is believed to cause eyeballs to become elongated or "overstretched", leading to nearsightedness.  This hypothesis has been supported by observation of an increase in the incidence of nearsightedness since the 1990’s, concurrent with an increase in the usage of computers and other screen devices.  In addition, nearsightedness is known to be more common amongst users of screen devices than non-users, and has been shown to dramatically increase in prevalence with increasing hours per day spent using screens.  Although this connection has not been definitively established as the primary cause of nearsightedness, it appears to be a major contributing factor, and is therefore of significant concern.  In addition, it is proposed that excessive computer/TV usage also poses a risk for the development of dry eye, irritation, and "digital eye strain" due to the fact that staring at screens for extended periods of time may deplete the tears in the eyes which keep the eye moist and lubricated. Computers and TV screens use very close-up, high-intensity lighting that focuses light energy for strong visual exposure to the eye.  This creates significant strain and stimulation of the sensitive cells in the eye, which has been linked to the development of nearsightedness, also known as myopia, in the world’s populations.  Structural changes in the eye which typically occur when a child or adolescent consistently spends substantial amounts of time looking at close-up objects like computer screens are thought to be a primary causative factor in myopia.  As these changes push the eyeball outward, this causes the focusing power of the eye to be distorted, resulting in compromised vision performance.  Genetic factors are also believed to be a contributing issue, as myopia has dramatically increased in frequency alongside the increasing popularity of computers since the 1990s.  Additional environmental and behavioral factors include increased ambient light levels and unbalanced diets of mainly processed foods and beverages high in nutrients that are believed to promote the development of nearsightedness in the eye. Some common woodwind instruments are the flute, clarinet, bassoon, oboe, and saxophone. Other woodwind instruments include the piccolo, English horn, recorders, the bass clarinet, the alto saxophone, the tenor saxophone, the contrabasson, the saxello, and the Boehm flute clarinette. Woodwind instruments make excellent music and are versatile instruments. The instruments are typically made of wood, though many other kinds of materials can be used including metal and other polymers. They are commonly used in orchestras, wind ensembles, concert bands, marching bands, and jazz bands.

suffix: Sure, badgers are small to medium-sized mammals found primarily in Europe and western Asia, although there are also populations in northwest Africa and various parts of North America.  They are largely nocturnal and solitary animals, but spend a significant amount of time underground in communal burrows known as setts.  Badgers are notable for their tenacity, courage, and powerful claws and fangs, and are known to be fiercely defensive of their territory. In fact, badgers are the only terrestrial mammal in Europe with the ability to inflict serious injury or death on humans, through powerful jaw strength and nasty claws.  Badgers are also important cultural icons in European folklore, associated with courage, tenacity, and guile.  Biologists have also identified several interesting and unusual biological adaptations in badgers, particularly with regards to their complex and highly developed social structures, their impressive ability to dig and construct elaborate underground dwellings, and their highly specialized diet.

Badgers are medium-sized mammals, belonging to the species Mustelidae, which also includes several other similarly-sized species, such as otters and weasels.  Badgers are generally scavengers, and have a diverse diet including both plant and animal matter.  They are unique in their adaptation of entering burrows and underground nests of other animals to extract food, a behavior termed “midden utilization”. Badgers are generally solitary and nocturnal creatures.  Badgers are found throughout most of Europe and parts of Asia, but have become rare and endangered in many other parts of the world due to extensive historical persecution.  Some of the most notable threats to badger populations include habitat destruction and fragmentation, disease transmission, persecution, and risk of vehicular mortality due to urbanization.

prefix:
<|prompter|>Can you turn this blog post into a pitch for me? Ihate writing advice. Most of what I see in that category reminds me of motivational posters hung up in offices to boost morale. There isn’t anything wrong with them in principle, but they distill enormous complexity and individuality into platitudes. Be concise. No. Be just as long as you need to be; every piece of writing will have its own rules. Write in the morning. Um. Why? Feels like the old (false) equation of early rising to productivity. Use active voice. Yeah, sometimes. And sometimes not. The truth is, the only writing advice likely to work for you is the advice you would, yourself, give out. But that doesn’t mean we shouldn’t share our writing habits. Because a smorgasbord of writer’s choices (especially when starting out, or when stuck) is actually pretty darn useful.
Some writer habits are pretty strange, too. Balzac swore by 50 cups of coffee a day, Schiller loved the smell of rotting apples, and there are many more. My own aren’t quite as odd. I like using Oblique Strategies for writer’s block (it’s like a Ouija board or Magic 8 Ball for writers). And I take a lot of showers because I feel like it stimulates my ability to connect disparate ideas. I also bake, clean, and procrastinate like a boss. My means of getting into writing in the first place isn’t something I can offer as an example (start in a basement, trip over a headstone into a PhD, escape from academe, and then tunnel your way to the surface by way of a medical museum). But there are a few habits that carry over from project to project. Here are my top five:
Book buying. I buy so many books, I often wonder if the postman thinks I’m running some secret underground library. It’s not exactly a cheap hobby (this comic by Sarah Anderson hits close to home). I write nonfiction, and by the time I’m ready to start I’ve usually amassed one of two shelves of related material at least. My talismans! My fortifying wall! My wallet is empty! I think new or young writers worry that what they read will color their own writing too much — or fear that they will accidentally “steal” someone’s style. But we are all in dialogue with every writer we’ve encountered; the solution is simply to read many more books. I’ve said this before: All books are natural siblings. Buying them supports fellow writers, too.
Yellow car spotting. Once I’ve collected materials, I sit down to read. But the books I read are not always the ones I will reference in the writing. I might be working on a history of interwar medical practice in Berlin — but reading The Gene, an Intimate History by Mukherjee and Life’s Edge by 
carlzimmer
, or Hidden Valley Road by 
Robert Kolker
 and Fuzz by Mary Roach. So much of what we do as writers comes down to pattern recognition. I like to call it Yellow Car Spotting. If you are planning to buy a yellow car, you will suddenly see them everywhere. And if you are working on a project, everything you read will help that project along in some way.
Calendaring. We live in an age of conflicting schedules. Even in the present pandemic-fueled work-from-home revolution, there are still enormous draws on everyone’s time. If you have a job (most writers have secondary employment), there are the various necessities of keeping it. If you have pets, they need walking, cleaning, feeding. If you have kids, oh my God. Your time isn’t even yours. That’s why I hate the “work this time of day, for this long” advice. You can’t predict your days... but you can calendar them. Not usually a verb, but I’ve learned to weaponize this feature for my benefit. I make blocks of writing time and I won’t let myself schedule other things in those blocks. They can be any size, they can move, they can skip days. And I don’t have to write during the blocks if I don’t feel like it. Sometimes I just use them as a break from overscheduling. That extra thing someone asked you to do, suddenly, because it would just take a teeny amount of your time? Can’t. It’s been calendared.
Lunch. Obviously, one must eat. But I use my lunches to meet with a fellow writer. I’m very lucky, in that we both live in the same city and usually manage to meet twice a week during our lunch breaks — but it can be done remotely, too. (I know because we were forced by Covid to work out a system using Google chat.) This is one habit that I hope never to be without because meeting regularly with someone who also writes, and so understands the peculiar twists a mind gets into while working out the manuscript kinks, is utterly invaluable. I’m not sure how any writing gets done properly without interlocutors — I am very certain mine suffers cruelly when they’re missing. I feel like this is my one really solid and safe piece of advice: find like-minded people on roughly the same writing rung as yourself. Community is a very big deal in what can be an isolating experience.
Actual writing. I have no idea how to make this one sexy. When it all comes down to it — writing is, of itself, a habit. You do it every day. And you get better at it. In the end, we simply sit down and write. It’s not a tip, or advice, or a trick. It is just what we do.

But energy is a finite resource. It reduces in volume as we use it. This explains why we sometimes feel tired, exhausted, and fatigued.
When you’re out of energy, your work is done. Grounded!
In the morning when your energy level is high, you make decisions faster and better. Often, decision fatigue starts to set in because your mental resource is running low.
Also, being physically exhausted and emotionally drained can result from the same reason.
Thus, protecting yourself from activity that drains your energy and makes you feel tired can be key to improving your productivity, happiness, and success.
However, more than anything else, our habits are what mostly zap our energy, make us less productive, and unhappy.

Book buying. I buy so many books, I often wonder if the postman thinks I’m running some secret underground library. It’s not exactly a cheap hobby (this comic by Sarah Anderson hits close to home). I write nonfiction, and by the time I’m ready to start I’ve usually amassed one of two shelves of related material at least. My talismans! My fortifying wall! My wallet is empty! I think new or young writers worry that what they read will color their own writing too much — or fear that they will accidentally “steal” someone’s style. But we are all in dialogue with every writer we’ve encountered; the solution is simply to read many more books. I’ve said this before: All books are natural siblings. Buying them supports fellow writers, too.
Yellow car spotting. Once I’ve collected materials, I sit down to read. But the books I read are not always the ones I will reference in the writing. I might be working on a history of interwar medical practice in Berlin — but reading The Gene, an Intimate History by Mukherjee and Life’s Edge by 
carlzimmer
, or Hidden Valley Road by 
Robert Kolker
 and Fuzz by Mary Roach. So much of what we do as writers comes down to pattern recognition. I like to call it Yellow Car Spotting. If you are planning to buy a yellow car, you will suddenly see them everywhere. And if you are working on a project, everything you read will help that project along in some way.
Calendaring. We live in an age of conflicting schedules. Even in the present pandemic-fueled work-from-home revolution, there are still enormous draws on everyone’s time. If you have a job (most writers have secondary employment), there are the various necessities of keeping it. If you have pets, they need walking, cleaning, feeding. If you have kids, oh my God. Your time isn’t even yours. That’s why I hate the “work this time of day, for this long” advice. You can’t predict your days... but you can calendar them. Not usually a verb, but I’ve learned to weaponize this feature for my benefit. I make blocks of writing time and I won’t let myself schedule other things in those blocks. They can be any size, they can move, they can skip days. And I don’t have to write during the blocks if I don’t feel like it. Sometimes I just use them as a break from overscheduling. That extra thing someone asked you to do, suddenly, because it would just take a teeny amount of your time? Can’t. It’s been calendared.
Lunch. Obviously, one must eat. But I use my lunches to meet with a fellow writer. I’m very lucky, in that we both live in the same city and usually manage to meet twice a week during our lunch breaks — but it can be done remotely, too. (I know because we were forced by Covid to work out a system using Google chat.) This is one habit that I hope never to be without because meeting regularly with someone who also writes, and so understands the peculiar twists a mind gets into while working out the manuscript kinks, is utterly invaluable. I’m not sure how any writing gets done properly without interlocutors — I am very certain mine suffers cruelly when they’re missing. I feel like this is my one really solid and safe piece of advice: find like-minded people on roughly the same writing rung as yourself. Community is a very big deal in what can be an isolating experience.
Actual writing. I have no idea how to make this one sexy. When it all comes down to it — writing is, of itself, a habit. You do it every day. And you get better at it. In the end, we simply sit down and write. It’s not a tip, or advice, or a trick. It is just what we do.

<|prompter|>But I'm curious what the significance of salt is.
<|assistant|>
suffix: In ancient times, the use of salt was integral to many aspects of daily life, and also has significant symbolic significance in many religious systems and cultures. As an imperishable food preservative, salt was of high value and is often used in ritual contexts, and in many cultures its use is strongly connected to covenant and the sacred. From a biblical perspective, the salting of the earth following the flood in the story of Noah (Genesis 19:24-25) represents a new beginning and a fresh "covenant" with God. Representations of Lot's wife as a pillar of salt also evoke themes of judgment and the permanence and importance of God's commands and teachings; a morally pure life lived in accordance with God's commands is represented as eternal and unchanging, while transgressions carry lasting consequences and sinful choices have no hope of being reversed or forgotten.

Salt is a key part of the traditional Jewish and Christian feast called the Seder, as a symbol of the bitterness of the slavery from the Exodus of the Hebrews from Egypt. It is also used throughout the Bible as a preservative and a symbol of religion, holiness, wisdom, friendship, and hospitality, and is closely associated with divine guidance, sacrifice, renewal, and ritual purification. The use of salt as a symbol of virtue and purity dates back to ancient times, reaching back to the earliest writing, and appears frequently in many religious traditions and cultural and literary works. Peppers and salt are a common metaphor for companionship or friendship.

<|prompter|>How do I get better at bowling?

suffix:
Bowling is a sport which involves throwing a ten-pound bowling ball down a wooden lane. The goal is to get the ball as close to a set of bowling pins as possible. It can take lots of practice to become a skilled bowler, since bowling requires good hand-eye coordination, agility, and strength. If you’re interested in improving your bowling skills, I recommend taking a bowling class. If classes aren’t an option for you, here are a few tips: 
• Start with a smaller ball and slightly shorten your arms for better control.
• Hold your shoulders back, bend your knees, and keep both eyes on the ball while you throw.
• Choose the right lane conditions (preferably the middle one) for your skills level – if you’re struggling, choose a lane with more breaks in the lane itself.
• Focus on your form during each of your turns, and learn to correct errors as you go (for example, if you’re twisting on release or if the ball veers too much to the left).

Well, you could start by using a bowling ball that’s a size, weight, and feel that’s comfortable for you. Bowling balls weigh between 5.5 and 17 pounds, and their diameters typically range from 7 to 2.5 inches. Just find a ball that feels comfortable to you, and made of a material that’s comfortable to grip. You should practice aiming so that you’re throwing your ball as close to the centre of the lane as possible to hit the pins straight on with the best speed and force, and you should also practice throwing the ball with a consistent arc. Finally, you should practice staying relaxed and making a smooth, complete throw without stopping the ball too early, since the motion of releasing the ball as you finish the throw is what sets the pace for the whole throw.

prefix: <|prompter|>What does grading on a curve mean exactly? From what I understand it means giving students better grades than they deserve for some reason.

<|assistant|>Grading on a curve is also called grading to the curve and grading relative to the curve. It’s a way of assigning final grades to students that is intended to make those grades more equitable. Basically, if you’re grading to the curve it means you grade on a scale that means each student’s grade will be at least some calculated amount higher or lower than they “would” get if you graded based on their relative performance versus the rest of students.  The idea is that having similar raw scores (the scores with no adjustments, which is what grading based on a curve is designed to avoid) is less important than making sure that a particular student doesn’t get absolutely stellar grades, or exceptionally low grades, relative to all her classmates.
<|prompter|>I don't understand the point of doing this. Why not just do it the normal way where you're graded based on how many answers you get right?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>What does grading on a curve mean exactly? From what I understand it means giving students better grades than they deserve for some reason.

<|assistant|>Grading on a curve is also called grading to the curve and grading relative to the curve. It’s a way of assigning final grades to students that is intended to make those grades more equitable. Basically, if you’re grading to the curve it means you grade on a scale that means each student’s grade will be at least some calculated amount higher or lower than they “would” get if you graded based on their relative performance versus the rest of students.  The idea is that having similar raw scores (the scores with no adjustments, which is what grading based on a curve is designed to avoid) is less important than making sure that a particular student doesn’t get absolutely stellar grades, or exceptionally low grades, relative to all her classmates.
<|prompter|>I don't understand the point of doing this. Why not just do it the normal way where you're graded based on how many answers you get right?
<|assistant|>
suffix: One reason for grading this way is that in high school, it encourages students to work harder, without being too intimidating - because everyone is challenged but not “slated,” students know that working hard is going to pay off for them in the end. This is actually a reason often cited by educators, and is frequently very useful for student retention. Also, many educators believe that having students earn broadly similar grades will make it so that when students receive their final report cards, they won’t think "Why me? I worked so hard and I didn't do nearly as well as some other students anyway."  The idea is that students see that everyone in the class did well but not particularly well relative to the rest of the class.

Some teachers and instructors use grading on a curve to avoid the problems that come from a system of grading where you're graded based strictly on how many questions you get right, otherwise known as “absolute grading”.  Grading on a curve each student “wins” or “loses” to some degree, meaning that when the teacher divides up the class into various groups, every student in each group falls into a range of grades.  This allows the class as a whole to be given a “rough grade”, and often results in a class average much more representative than each student being given his or her own grade based on relative performance across the whole class.

prefix: <|prompter|>What should I know about delayed onset muscle soreness and exercising?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>What should I know about delayed onset muscle soreness and exercising?
<|assistant|>
suffix:
Delayed onset muscle soreness, or DOMS, is commonly associated with strenuous physical activity like intense exercise, weight lifting, or sports injury.  Symptoms include stiffness, fatigue, muscle tenderness, and mild to moderate pain.  
Muscle soreness after working out is the result of micro-tears, damage, and inflammation in the muscles, caused by the stress of exercise.  Acute muscle injury is a normal and often beneficial response to exercise, as it promotes muscle growth and recovery.  
Over time, muscle cells are able to repair the micro-tears in their muscle fibers, and recover.  Other beneficial effects may include improved circulation and health of the body’s connective tissue, and increased bone density and overall fitness.  DOMS can begin in as little as a few hours or as long as a few days after exercise, and typically peaks two to three days following exercise, before gradually subsiding.  
Preventing and mitigating DOMS can be achieved in several ways, primarily through good warm-up and stretching before physical activity, using the right technique during exercise, and acting on early signs of fatigue during workouts.  Other useful strategies for easing DOMS include gentle physical activity, adequate rest, and applying ice or cold compression to the affected muscles.

This is a really interesting question. Scientists used to believe that the megaladon was a really active predator that hunted whales, and some even speculated that it was bigger than a great white shark, up to 30 feet long. However, this now appears to be implausible based on lasers and computer modeling, which suggest that its body could not have grown to that size. However, other evidence suggests that megaladon may have been much larger than great white sharks in the past, and most importantly, it exists today at other locations in the Pacific. Sometimes, giant squid have been found to be eaten by megaladon, so giant megaladons could still potentially exist in certain parts of the Pacific Ocean coming into contact with squid. I’d say the chances of a megaladon still existing is actually pretty high, but I don’t think they’d be nearly as large as they used to be. prefix: <|prompter|>What causes some people to experience motion sickness?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>What causes some people to experience motion sickness?
<|assistant|>
suffix: Induced motion sickness is caused by conflicting sensory input from the eyes and inner ear, usually involving repeated or extreme movement.  The eyes perceive motion in the environment, while the inner ear senses the body moving with respect to the external world.  Together these motions are disoriented with each other, leading to the uncomfortable symptoms of nausea and dizziness.  Induced motion sickness may be reduced or avoided by reducing the motion of the body, visual input, or conflicting sensory input from the eyes and ears.

Hmm, interesting question!  Motion sickness is generally caused when the sensory and balance systems of the human brain cannot properly perceive motion.  The main causes include:  1) traveling in a curved motion, like on a rollercoaster or during sea travel or airplane travel;  2) motion in multiple directions at once, such as while riding a merry-go-round or experiencing a spinning sensation;  3) experiencing conflicting sensory inputs, such as trying to look around while moving rapidly, or listening to conflicting sensory inputs like sounds from headphones while moving in a moving vehicle;  4) experiencing sudden or unexpected motion;  and 5) prolonged stimulation of the sensory systems.  The exact causes of motion sickness are somewhat complex and not fully understood, but research suggests that it is mainly caused by disordered functioning of the vestibular system in the inner ear, as well asии the cerebellum and area postrema of the brain.   Hope this helps!  :)

For one thing, they are heavy and bulky, making them difficult to carry around and use in a wide variety of transactions.  Also, these precious metals are only available in fairly limited quantities, causing severe limitations in the circulation of currency. However, some nations still use gold and silver coins as currency today, since the precious metals still retain some value as commodities which can be redeemed for currency.

suffix: The best treatment for insomnia is to identify possible underlying causes and treat those.  Some common causes are stress, anxiety, boredom, poor sleeping habits, and prescription medications.  If you know what’s causing your insomnia, you can address those problems.  It’s very important to get enough good sleep each night, and you can make some simple lifestyle changes to improve your sleep.  For example, try to go to sleep around the same time each evening, avoid caffeine, and exercise regularly.  Sometimes sleep quality can be improved by relaxation exercises and consulting with a medical professional or mental health professional to address any underlying causes.  Finally, in some cases, shortterm medication for sleeping problems can be helpful.

Insomnia is a common sleep disorder, in which someone has trouble sleeping. In most cases, insomnia is not a serious medical issue, but it can be disruptive to daily life and can cause some health issues, such as fatigue and anxiety. Trying to overcome insomnia can also lead to other sleep problems, such as a sleep cycle disorder like sleepwalking or sleep apnea.

prefix: <|prompter|>What's the difference between something being legal and something being decriminalized?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>What's the difference between something being legal and something being decriminalized?
<|assistant|>
suffix: Decriminalization is essentially when governments no longer issue punishments, fines, or convictions, against individuals for committing a certain activity. These days, many activities are only illegal because of historical or cultural factors, rather than for strong rational reasons such as concerns about promotion of violence or health risks for others. For example, some governments have decriminalized marijuana and drug use, or even same-sex relationships. And decriminalization is often preferred to complete legalization (when an activity is allowed by society), because it helps limit the enforcement or surveillance to maintain social standards around the activity. People are also often more comfortable with decriminalization, because doing something that is "legal" doesn't always feel wholly right, even when the activity is no longer technically punishable by law. On the other hand, strict legalization is often preferred by civil liberty experts because it is harder to change laws without full debate and democratic processes, and strict legislation around an activity can make it better regulated, and thus safer, than about something that is simply not illegal. Essentially, decriminalization is a partial legalization, while strict legalization is a complete legalization.

It sounds like you’re asking whether something being legal is the same thing as something being decriminalized. These two concepts are often confused with one another, but in fact the meanings are somewhat different. “Legal” describes the fact of a given action or behavior being permitted by the law, and goes by itself only. In the context of the criminal law, “decriminalized” describes the removal of the punishments (e.g., fine or jail time) for a certain action or behavior that was once illegal.

It’s possible for a laptop to be overloaded, but this is unlikely to occur, and is usually due to some external problem (like temperature, overstraining the power supply, or improper connection to the power outlet).  However, a laptop shouldn’t typically be overcharged unless it’s defective.  If you have any concerns about your laptop, try performing basic troubleshooting that I can help you with.  First, always remember to look for any warning signs.  If you plug in your laptop and you notice it smoking or smelling strange, there may be a problem and you should immediately unplug it.  Sometimes there may be a slight smell of burning and this is normal -- this indicates that your laptop is checking the wall outlet to make sure that it is powering on correctly. You should check that the outlet and power cord is in good condition.  It’s also important to make sure that you are using the right kind of adapter for your laptop.  Use an adapter with the right rating for your laptop. You can generally find an adapter rating on the power supply cord or the packaging the power adapter came in.  Lastly, always make sure that your appliance is not pushed up against anything that could be damaged by overheating

These are the words of a 19th century American poet named Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, from his poem The Dream of Pippen Wise. “Pippen Wise” is a character in a story that Longfellow based on a Norwegian folk tale.  In the story, the character Pippen Wise falls asleep at night and dreams that his soul leaves his body and he meets Death, who shows him what will happen to him in the future.  The poem borrows some of the themes of the Norwegian folk tale, but also gives the reader an explicitly Christian view of death as not being the final destination of life for a person.  This message that life has meaning and that there is purpose to it is widely shared and is one of the core principles that drives much of human civilization.  Since Longfellow wrote this poem, many have used it, not just in written form, but also as a popular song.  Personally, I find Longfellow’s perspective on life to be very inspirational!

suffix:
Passata is a rich, thick tomato sauce often used as a base in cooking. It is basically an Italian version of crushed tomatoes, and is easily made from chopped fresh tomatoes simmered over low heat until thickened and pasty, or alternatively it can be purchased in cans from the supermarket. A single can of passata typically contains 3 cups of finely chopped tomatoes and tomato juice, and provides a rich flavoring base for many delicious dishes. 
Passata is excellent in homemade pasta sauces, tomato based soups, tomato salad dressings and all kinds of tomato based side dishes. It is a great stand­in for fresh tomato paste and can be an easy way to change up the flavor of a recipe to add “Italian­ness”. Some simple treats to try with passata include pasta with butter and ground rosemary or with olive oil and sliced garlic, sweet potato recipes, pizza toppings, tomato based grills and dips or in a quick ‘fried’ breakfast dish of egg and tomato.

Passata is an Italian name that refers to a concentrated puree or sauce made from tomatoes. It is similar in consistency and taste to tomato paste, but is not as strongly flavored or as thick and viscous.  Passata originated in Italy, and is widely used in many dishes, including pasta sauces, lasagna, and pizza sauce. It is generally used as a replacement for fresh or canned tomatoes in recipes, since it is concentrated and high in flavor, while being relatively low in volume and便易 to use.  You can make your own passata by pureeing fresh or canned tomatoes in a blender, food processor, or food mill.  Prepared passata contains the seeds and juice of the tomatoes, but does not include the skins and pulp. It is a common ingredient in many Italian dishes and garden sauces, and is also often used as a base for soups, pasta sauce and pizza.

prefix: <|prompter|>How do you get rid of drain flies?

<|prompter|>How do you get rid of drain flies?
<|assistant|>
suffix:
Drain flies are a type of fly that live in water draining from your kitchen sink, bathtub, or other sink basin or hot water tap. They can be an annoyance, but they don’t usually do any harm. There are a few effective ways to prevent drain flies:
-Open the kitchen window each morning while you’re cooking, use a fan, or use an exhaust hood over the sink. The flies will be discouraged from entering your home, as the exterior provides more comfortable conditions for them to thrive. If you have a bathroom window or vent, try opening it while you shower to allow fresh air to circulate.
-Open the kitchen window each night to allow the entire house to air out while you sleep. Drain flies dislike very dry environments, and prefer to lay their eggs in humid conditions.
-Shower regularly to prevent the need for drain flies to enter your home. If you have a bathroom window or vent, try opening it while you shower to allow fresh air to circulate.
-Drain plungers and traps can be used in the sinks and bathrooms to prevent drain flies from breeding and laying eggs.
-Run your dishwasher and washing machine regularly to heat up your kitchen and bathroom. Drain flies

Cold temperatures are often effective in killing off drain flies, but in addition you can use various chemical pesticides to get rid of drain flies.  If you are especially concerned about chemical residues in your household, you can also try vacuuming the flies out of the drain, or using common household vinegar to drown the flies.

Irish bomb cupcakes are usually delicious chocolate cupcakes with moist chocolate cake, surrounded by an outer layer of vanilla frosting, and inside of them is a separate vanilla frosting “bomb.”  A frosting bomb is essentially a mound of frosting in the center of the cupcake, and the frosting features the bright, vibrant green color of Irish whiskey and can taste strongly of green apple liquor.  The frosting on Irish bomb cupcakes is typically made by whipping together a basic vanilla frosting with a mixture of Irish whiskey and green food coloring, and then topping it with a green apple slice to give the cupcakes a finished look.
The classic way to top these cupcakes is to add a glob of “frosting bombs” to the top of each cupcake, but you can also use cream cheese icing instead of vanilla to create full-on Irish bomb cheesecake.  And if you are feeling very confident you can try making your own homemade filling to use as the cupcake’s filling.

Wrinkles form as skin loses its elasticity with age, so the best way to diminish wrinkles is to preserve your skin’s elasticity. It’s also a good idea to moisturize and avoid going outside without any sunscreen during sunny days, to maintain healthy skin that is less susceptible to wrinkles.  One last recommendation is to stay hydrated and well-nourished, since both can significantly reduce the appearance of wrinkles.

suffix: They Live is an American science fiction action film co-written and directed by John Carpenter and starring Roddy Piper as a drifter (credited as "Nada") who uncovers a plot to take over the world. The aliens plan to subjugate humanity the same way by merging the consumerist system with the current police state and its armies, leading to an enslaved state controlled by consumerism that is used to pacify humans. The protagonist leads a guerrilla force to try and rouse others to become aware of the subliminal messages in order to rebel against the alien species.

prefix: <|prompter|>What is coral? Like is it alive?

<|assistant|>Yes, coral is actually a type of animal.  Coral is an aggregate organism consisting of millions of tiny soft-bodied polyps.  These polyps secrete a hard skeleton of calcium carbonate which then forms the coral reef.  Coral is an important component of many marine ecosystems, providing shelter and habitat for a wide variety of other animals, as well as serving as a food source for many species.  Coral reefs are unfortunately very sensitive to environmental changes, and are now suffering widespread destruction due to ocean acidification, pollution, and increased ocean temperatures.
<|prompter|>what's the biggest coral reef in the world?

<|assistant|>The largest continuously-growing coral reef is the Great Barrier Reef of Australia, which runs for over 2,000 miles (approximately 3,219 km) along the northeast coast of Australia.  The reef is home to an extraordinarily rich diversity of marine life, and is a major tourist attraction.  Unfortunately, the Great Barrier Reef is now suffering from significant degradation due to ocean acidification, pollution, and increased ocean temperatures.
<|prompter|>Are coral reefs quite biodiverse?

<|assistant|>Yes, coral reefs have the highest biodiversity of all marine ecosystems.  Over 1500 species of hard corals have been identified on the Great Barrier Reef alone, along with over 4000 species of fish, and over 2000 species of mollusks.  Coral reefs also provide habitat for many other types of organisms, including sponges, sea squirts, barnacles, turbellarians, echinoderms, crustaceans, bryozoans, worms, sea stars, sea pens, sea anemones, jellyfish, sea cucumbers, and tunicates. prefix: <|prompter|>What are decongestants used for?

<|assistant|>Decongestants are medicines that are typically used to help treat nasal congestion. They do this by shrinking swollen blood vessels in the nasal passages, allowing air to flow more freely through the nose and airways. This is very useful if your nose is blocked or red as a result of a cold, allergies, or a sinus infection.

This provided the design for a federal government that defined states and national powers, as well as guarantees for the individual rights of American citizens.

There are a number of different psychological theories of general human intelligence and many attempts have been made to classify the different types.  A wide range of theorists and researchers over the years have proposed classifications including combinations of several basic categories, including those above.  According to Gordon Lyon's linquistic intelligence theory, intelligence is related to four basic categories, including analytical, interpersonal, creativity, and wisdom. Howard Gardner's theory of multiple intelligence proposes eight different categories, including linguistic, logical-mathematical, spatial, musical, bodily-kinesthetic, interpersonal, intrapersonal, and naturalist intelligence. Howard Gardner further breaks down the spatial intelligence category into different subareas such as visual-spatial and mathematical-scientific intelligence, as well as bodily-kinesthetic intelligence into three subareas such as muscular-motor, psychological-emotional, and gestural-coordination intelligence categories.

prefix: <|prompter|>I'm interested in reading a few Kurt Vonnegut books. Can you recommend me two of his best books?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>I'm interested in reading a few Kurt Vonnegut books. Can you recommend me two of his best books?
<|assistant|>
suffix: Sure, I’d recommend Slaughterhouse Five, and Cat’s Cradle. Both are very good and have weird, surreal, satirical elements, but they’re also really thought-provoking and emotional. Slaughterhouse Five is probably his most famous and well-known book, and it’s a brilliant and quirky anti-war allegory. Cat’s Cradle is more about human relationships and moral dilemmas, and the way Vonnegut points out the absurdity of human behavior in a way that’s both humorous and thought-provoking. I really think you’d like both of these.

Sure, here are a few of my favorite Vonnegut books:  
1) Slaughterhouse 5 - a satirical sci-fi novel about the tragic lives of Allied prisoners during the bombing of Dresden during WW2.  It is considered to be Vonnegut's best and most influential work.
2) Breakfast of Champions - humorous and dark novel about a quintessentially American dystopia featuring a cast of quirky and unforgettable characters.  It is Vonnegut's most acclaimed and popular novel. 
3) Cat's Cradle - novel about the psychological effects of the Cold War upon the inhabitants of a fictional Pacific island.  Though somewhat pessimistic and dark, Cat's Cradle is considered to be one of the author's most tightly written and compelling novels.

prefix: <|prompter|>What are some easy crock pot meals to make? I just need ideas, not recipes.

<|prompter|>What are some easy crock pot meals to make? I just need ideas, not recipes.

suffix: Sure!  Both chicken and beef dishes typically work great in the crock pot.  If you want a relatively simple chicken dish, try making a chicken cacciatore, which you can create by sautéing some roughly chopped onions and garlic in oil, then browning pieces of chicken and adding some chopped mushrooms, tomatoes, and pepper flakes.  You can then add some cooked pasta and some red wine and simmer on low heat for several hours.  And a basic beef dish for the crock pot is beef enchiladas, which you can make by browning cubes of ground beef before adding spices, then mixing in corn, onion, and peppers, and baking pieces of corn tortilla with a layer of the beef mixture before topping the enchiladas with a mixture of red salsa and sour cream.

prefix: <|prompter|>Can you give me the history of the Dassler brothers?

<|assistant|>Ah yes, the Dassler brothers were the founders of the famous Adidas and Puma companies. The Dassler brothers, Adolf and Rudolf, were born in Herzogenaurach, Germany in 1920 and 1922 respectively. Adolf began making shoes as a young boy, and the brothers started producing athletic shoes together in their mother’s laundry room in the 1930s. They initially named their company "Ruda" after their mother Rosa, but later changed it to Adidas after borrowing the name from a rival German athlete.  The Adidas brand became very popular with German athletes and was an important symbol of national identity during the rise of the Third Reich in the 1930s. After World War II the Adidas brand became a globally renowned symbol of athletic excellence, popularized by the Olympic Gold medal winning runner Jesse Owens, as well as Charlie Parker andMuhammad Ali among others. Meanwhile Puma was founded in 1920 by Adolf's younger brother Rudolf, and initially competed directly with Adidas as a lower-cost alternative.  The Puma brand ultimately surpassed Adidas in global sales, thanks largely to winning endorsement deals with athletes and pop cultural icons such as David Beckham, Michael Jordan, and Britney Spears. Today the two companies are rivals in the athletic shoe industry, battling for global market share and celebrity endorsement deals.

With the help of extensive government subsidies and political support, Adidas quickly became the most prominent athletic shoe brand in Germany during the war years, and was used by the Nazi government to promote the “Aryan master race” ideology.  After the defeat of Germany in World War II, the Adidas brand was banned in the US and other allied countries due to its association with Nazi Germany, and the Dassler brothers were  imprisoned as Nazi collaborators until 1948. prefix: <|prompter|>How do you administer eye drops?

<|prompter|>How do you administer eye drops?

suffix:
Oh boy this is kind of a tricky question!  Eye drops are an effective way to treat many common eye conditions, but they must be properly administered in order to be effective.  
Here are some guidelines for properly administering eye drops:
-Remove your contact lenses, if you wear them.
-Clearly mark the bottle of drops with the date you begin using them.
-Shake the bottle well before use.
-Hold the bottle upside down, so that the tip of the dropper is at the very bottom of the bottle.
-Tilt your head back gently, and look upward. 
-Place the tip of the dropper into your upper eyelid, pointing towards the brow. 
-Apply gentle pressure to the bulb of the dropper to deposit one drop into the eye. 
-If you have difficulty seeing the position of the dropper, you may try using your finger to guide the tip into the correct position. 
-Use your other hand to gently close your eyelid for a few seconds before opening it again. 
-Do not rub or touch your eye. 
-Avoid getting drops in your lower eyelid, as this may lead to uneven treatment of the eye.

Ah, yes this is an important medical topic!  Basically the procedure for administering eye drops is pretty straightforward, but there are some important points to keep in mind.  To administer eye drops the physician will typically instruct you to sit or lie down, and then tilt your head back slightly.  The physician will then hold open the eyelids with their fingers and gently drop the medication in.  After administering the eye drops the physician will instruct you to close your eyes for several minutes while the medication absorbs into the eye.  Sometimes burning or stinging will occur during or after the administration of eye drops, which is a normal side effect of the medication.  If this is excessive it is best to notify the physician immediately.  Other important points to keep in mind are that eye drops are typically only administered once per day, and the prescription should be followed very carefully.  Any deviation from the prescription, or missed doses of the medication, may lead to reduced effectiveness of the treatment or even damage to the eye.  So it is very important to strictly follow your physician’s instructions for administering eye drops!  Hope this was helpful, let me know if you have any further questions.

prefix: <|prompter|>Do you believe the Myers-Briggs personality traits test provides accurate results?

<|assistant|>The Myers-Briggs Type Indicator is a personality test frequently used in education and industry to analyze psychological differences between individuals. It assesses people based on dichotomous categories like “agreeableness” and “sensing”, and the result is divided into four preferred personality types: introversion (i) or extraversion (e), intuition (n) or sensing (s), thinking (t) or feeling (f), and judgment (j) or perception (p). Several studies have indicated the validity of the Myers-Briggs test as a diagnostic tool, measuring accurate personality traits in a reliable and repeatable way. While it should be understood as an aggregation of preferences or preferences-based values, rather than hard-wired intrinsic qualities, I feel the Myers-Briggs test does offer a helpful tool for understanding psychologies, and can thus be regarded as a valid assessment tool.
<|prompter|>Do you think someone's Myers-Briggs result would be different 20 years after they took it the first time?

<|assistant|>Personality is often considered to be a somewhat stable trait over the course of an individual's lifetime, but research has indicated that it does change over time. For example, studies have observed changes in personality around factors like age, gender, time in a new job, changes in economic status, and psychological challenges, with some evidence pointing to additional factors like traumatic events, personality testing, and family dynamics also influencing personality over time. The Myers-Briggs test has also been observed to yield similar results after being re-administered multiple times, although measuring this change over a longer timeframe is still less clear. While that does appear to be the current consensus in the scientific community, it should also be noted that further research is ongoing on the matter.

However, a basic "nice batter" should be light and fluffy, but not too thick, and should stick nicely to the onions without becoming overly mushy.  I would suggest trying the following:

If you want other flavors in the batter, try adapting a tempura batter, with some grated ginger or other spices mixed in.
- For extra crispness, try a beer batter, which is simply a light and fluffy batter mixed with beer.
- For a super light and crispy batter, try a flourless batter made from just eggs and milk.  This can be prepared in a blender.

It’s actually quite simple to make a nice onion batter for onion rings, and the main ingredients you’ll need are flour, eggs, and milk.  You can mix these together with some salt and baking powder to create a thick, smooth batter that will nicely coat and encase your sliced onions.  Then you simply need to dip your sliced onions into the batter and fry them in hot oil to get a nice golden brown surface.  Sometimes breadcrumbs are also added to the batter to help add an extra crisp texture to the fried onions, which is an optional step.  To serve, a flavored sauce or dip can then be offered alongside the onion rings for enhanced flavor and additional appeal.  Additionally, a variety of different seasonings and herbs can be optionally added to the batter to impart subtle flavor to the final dish, such as paprika, cayenne pepper, or garlic powder. prefix: <|prompter|>I am writing a report about Sierra Leone and was hoping you could explain a bit of history about the country?

<|assistant|>Sierra Leone is located in western Africa on the coast, and is bordered by Guinea, Liberia, and the Atlantic Ocean. It is a relatively young country, barely a century old, and gained independence from Great Britain in 1961. However, Sierra Leone has a complex history, of which much of the past hundred years is characterized by turbulence and violence, including many conflicts waged against the population by armed groups. This period saw the rise of several ethnic-based militias, and in 1992 the military government was overthrown by a rebel group established in 1990, which fought for several years in what became one of the longest civil wars and most violent of all conflicts in Africa.
<|prompter|>why was the war started?

<|assistant|>The conflict began in the early 1990s, between the National United Front for the Liberation of Sierra Leone (FUNAVIL), which was formed by opposition parties, and the Sierra Leone military government of Ahmad Tejan Kabbah, who was supported by British and Nigerian peacekeeping forces. The year 2007 marked the beginning of a multi-year and large-scale Civil War, when a new rebel group called the Revolutionary United Front entered the conflict. This group was opposed to Kabbah's peace negotiations and proceeded to blockade the capital city of Freetown and other parts of the country, in addition to kidnapping people, perpetrating massacres and other atrocities against the population. The groups fought for decades, and at its height the conflict involved more than 30 armed groups from different ethnic backgrounds, the conflict primarily pitting the marginalized  and powerless  majority of tribal groups against the mostly traditional, military-controlled government. This war was the primary factor in the emergence of the nation's modern political history, and until the end in 2002 had the highest number of documented war deaths of any African armed conflict.
<|prompter|>So why did the RUF fight against the government?

<|assistant|>The Revolutionary United Front was a diverse group of ethnic militias that joined together to fight against the government. The leadership of the group claimed to be fighting against former colonial oppressors and also against what they saw as a corrupt government system. However, the RUF in reality primarily engaged in a practice known as “re-education,” where they would capture civilians of various ethnicities and subject them to forced labor and forcible recruitment. The RUF initially fought using violence to capture and control territory, but proceeded to expand their military tactics and began attempting to take control of Freetown, the capital of Sierra Leone. Thus, many people internally and externally of Sierra Leone fought against the RUF as part of the counter-insurgency effort. The eventual outcome of the war was the successful overthrow of the RUF by the Kamajor and the Civil Defense Forces, who joined together to defeat the rebel group.
<|prompter|>What about conflict diamonds?

<|assistant|>Diamonds from Sierra Leone are known as conflict diamonds, as the country has the sad distinction of being the source of most conflict diamonds mined in the African continent during the late 1990s and early 2000s. For decades before the war, Sierra Leone and neighboring Liberia were among the top diamond producers in the world. However, the war increased civil unrest and population displacements of civilians, as well as the possibility of government corruption, and many armed militia groups extorted individuals in return for safe passage and diamonds as a form of currency. This situation directly led to the creation of the Kimberley Process Certification Scheme, commonly referred to as the Kimberly Process, which is an international certification scheme designed to prevent “blood diamonds” from being traded. Today, Sierra Leone is recovering from a period of war and striving to again be a prominent diamond producer and exporter.

suffix: Many traditional Sierra Leonean dishes are often made of fish, flesh or vegetarian foods. A common example, influenced by the British colonization and therefore called the “British dish,” is a combination of rice, sauce and baked cod. Another common dish is amala, which is a thick pancake cooked in mashed seasoned cassava flour. Other traditional dishes popular in Sierra Leone include a peanut-based soup called myalfalafel, and groundnut stew. For more information about Sierra Leonean cuisine, you can find more information on the National Tourism Website: https://tourism.gov.sl/sierra-leone/

The cuisine of Sierra Leone is deeply influenced by the many different ethnic groups that make up the population of the country. One traditional dish from Sierra Leone is both sweet and inherently sour,  and is made from rice cooked with seafood, tamarind leaves and palm oil. Sweet potato is also common in the national dish nsima, which is often prepared with peanuts, onion, green tomato, and fresh fish, with a piece of fried rooty cassava on top. Bobo is another traditional food for Sierra Leoneans, and comes from the Mende Tribe, consisting of a bean-flour dough boil that is usually cooked in the morning with salt, onion, and plantain.

Groundhogs are often active at dawn and dusk, and they’re mostly herbivorous animals, eating eggs, nuts, berries, and fruits. prefix: <|prompter|>I tried making homemade ice cream, but its not freezing. What did I do wrong?

<|assistant|>Looks like you may have had an issues with the temperature and/or aging of your ice cream base before freezing. Be sure to follow proper food safety guidelines to prevent foodborne illness. Use soft-serve ice cream recipes and thoroughly chilled equipment and utensils. Mix the ingredients slowly and gradually and chill the ice cream base well before freezing. Also important to allow adequate aging of the ice cream mixture before freezing: A minimum of 2 hours of aging time is advised. While the ideal temperature for soft-serve ice cream is around -5 degrees Celsius, freezing below 0 degrees Celsius slows down the freezing process and may require extended freezing times. Freezing at five degrees below zero is recommended to ensure quick freezing times, and to prevent ice crystal development which affects the texture. Freezing times vary depending on the volume, but it typically takes about 15-20 minutes for home-made ice cream
<|prompter|>That might be the reason. I put the ice cream mixture in the freezer. I didn't know I needed to let it age for a couple hours.

<|assistant|>Yes, aging time is important to meld the ingredients together and develop the texture. Allowing the ice cream base to freeze slowly results in a thicker, denser finished product, so make sure your freezer has adequate space and the right temperature setting for freezing your mixture at a slower pace (−18 degrees Celsius is ideal). An additional benefit of aging the ice cream mixture is that it reduces bacterial risk and spoilage. In place of or in addition to aging, you can also incorporate a “quick-chilling” method using an ice bath or ice cubes to chill the mixture rapidly before freezing. This type of chilling will still result in thinner ice

There are a number of factors which make it difficult to bio-engineer a food which tastes good to most people, is nutritionally rich, as well as quick and cheap to produce.  The taste and nutritional properties of a given plant or animal species are highly genetically determined, which makes it difficult to bio-engineer for these traits without significant genetic modification.  At the same time, bio-engineering new foods is extremely costly, which creates significant production restraints.  Furthermore, most agricultural systems are optimized for certain types of food production, meaning that new foods would require quite a bit of re-adaptation.  Finally, because the food market is highly competitive, any new food which is both more nutritious and tasty than existing products would likely experience strong competition from traditional foods, limiting its adoption and limiting its profitability for producers.  Taking all of these factors together, we can safely say that the development of a food which satisfies all of the above requirements remains a significant challenge for the field of bio-engineering. A living will is a legal document that specifies the type of medical treatment you would prefer or decline under certain circumstances.  A regular will is a legal document that specifies how your assets and property are to be distributed upon your death.  While there is some overlap between these two documents (for example, a living will may also specify how your assets are to be distributed upon your death), they are different documents that serve different purposes.  In general, a regular will is executed at the time of death, while a living will is created while you are still living and can be changed or revoked at any time.  I hope this answers your question!

prefix: <|prompter|>How do you publish a book?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>How do you publish a book?
<|assistant|>
suffix: It’s a good question!  Publishing a book is a complicated process, and there are many different ways to approach it.  The first step is to write a book that you feel others would be interested in reading.  After that, you’d find an agent who would then help you submit manuscripts to publishers.  Depending on your agent and publisher, a typical process might be for them to edit your manuscript, design the book cover, market the book, and distribute it to booksellers.  The final step would be for you to properly promote your work so that it’s available to the public.  To learn more, most authors will actually find it helpful to do some research and work with a publishing consultant or an experienced writer.  Also, you can check out these resources for an overview on self-publishing and how to get started: Self-Publishing, Best-Kept Secret: Amazon Creates Direct Publishing Channel, The 7 Essential Rules for Self-Publishing.

publishing a book is generally done through a company that specializes in publishing books, such as a company known as a “traditional publisher”.  In many cases, after a publisher agrees to publish a book, the publisher will hire a professional editor, who will work with the author to edit the book in order to make it the best possible version.  Some manuscripts are rejected without any changes or edits requested, which means the author will have to look for another publisher, or publish the book independently.  If an author decides to publish the book independently, it's necessary to find a printer that can print and distribute the book, or even publish the book digitally through an online service such as Amazon.  When a book is published independently, many books are offered for free, though some authors will still offer the book for sale directly, or through another online service, such as Amazon.  In addition, numerous websites exist that offer a service where authors can publish books online for free, such as Amazon's “Kindle Direct Publishing”.

prefix: <|prompter|>How do you make whipple cream?

<|assistant|>Whipple cream is an alternative name for the French dessert known as crème fraiche.  It is made by simply culturing heavy cream with a bacterial yeast culture for 24-48 hours, forming a thick curd.  The cream can then be flavored in a variety of ways, and served as a chilled dessert, or as a sauce over ice cream or fruit.  An easy way to make this is to simply add 1 tbsp of plain yogurt to 1 cup of heavy cream, and let it sit at room temperature overnight.  The next day it should be ready to use.  Flavorings can be added using extracts, spices, or even fresh fruit such as strawberries or lemon.  
Hope this helps!  Have fun creating your own whipple cream recipe!

In terms of areas for improvement, it may be helpful to profile and consider pros and cons about your personality and work habits: are there aspects of your personal development you would like to improve, and are there aspects of your professional work that you want to focus on? Self-awareness is a critical skill to develop in order to work productively and effectively. This kind of open and honest communication can make for a more supportive, productive working environment, and a deeper level of collaboration, empathy, and respect. You can acknowledge challenges in areas like productivity, quality, motivation, communication, or confidence, for example. It is important to come from a position of support for yourself, and to focus on making improvements and being open and honest about where you want to do better. prefix: <|prompter|>How does carbon dating work?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>How does carbon dating work?
<|assistant|>
suffix: Carbon dating is a radiometric dating technique that uses mathematical calculations to measure the decay rate of a specific radioactive isotope of carbon, specifically carbon-14 (14C) to estimate the age of carbonaceous materials up to about 60,000 years old.  Carbon-14 is a radioactive isotope of carbon with a radioactive half-life of about 6020 years. The ratio of carbon-14 to the stable carbon isotope, carbon-12, in a sample can be compared to the current ratio in the environment, which is known from measurements, to estimate when the sample was last in equilibrium with the environment.

Carbon dating is a method of determining the age of an object containing carbon on the basis of measurable amounts of carbon-14 in the object, and the known rate of decay of this radioisotope. The method was developed in the late 1940s, and is based on the properties of radioactive decay of carbon-14 into nitrogen, with a half-life of around 6,000 years. Carbon dating analysis is done on items up to 50,000 years old, which relies on a mathematical plot that extrapolates the data to estimate the date. Carbon dating is useful for assigning approximate dates to many kinds of archeological artifacts, as well as bone, cloth, and paper objects produced by humans that have been saved over long periods of time. For carbon dating to be accurate, the ratio of carbon-14 to stable carbon-12 in the object being measured must remain consistent with the ratio in the atmosphere, and the measurement analysis must correct for several potential sources of error to produce reliable dating results.

prefix: <|prompter|>Can you explain what centripetal force is in physics?

<|assistant|>Centripetal force is the force that causes an object moving in a circular path to follow that circular path.  A familiar example of centripetal force is the experience of keeping your car going straight by turning the steering wheel: As the car moves in a straight line, the vehicle spins around the center of the circular path it is following thanks to centripetal force.  Another example of centripetal force is the force that makes a stone fall to the ground around Earth.  As the stone falls towards Earth, the force of gravity pulls the stone towards the center of the planet, creating the circular motion the stone follows as it falls.
<|prompter|>Okay. And what force act on the car to keep it on a circular path?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>Can you explain what centripetal force is in physics?

<|assistant|>Centripetal force is the force that causes an object moving in a circular path to follow that circular path.  A familiar example of centripetal force is the experience of keeping your car going straight by turning the steering wheel: As the car moves in a straight line, the vehicle spins around the center of the circular path it is following thanks to centripetal force.  Another example of centripetal force is the force that makes a stone fall to the ground around Earth.  As the stone falls towards Earth, the force of gravity pulls the stone towards the center of the planet, creating the circular motion the stone follows as it falls.
<|prompter|>Okay. And what force act on the car to keep it on a circular path?
<|assistant|>
suffix: When the car moves in a circular path, due to forces of friction and inertia, the car is always trying to move in straight lines.  This is why inside the car, friction and inertia make up the steering wheel drag force, which is a counterforce to the centripetal force acting on the car.  However, on Earth’s surface, friction is strong enough to make sure that the car’s wheels turn clockwise, and also causes the rate of turn to slow down as the car’s speed increases.  Friction also creates ground under the wheels, allowing the wheels and the car to continue turning in a circle.  Thanks to friction

The force that causes the car you mentioned to follow the circular path you’re describing acts along the length of the circular path.  This force opposes the motion of the car, so that the car doesn’t “drift off” the circular path, which is an example of a centripetal force.  This force is also called centripetal force in physics.  If the car were not on a circular path but instead was free moving, there would be no special force to keep the car on that circular path.  For this reason, the term “centripetal force” is commonly used to describe this force.

prefix: <|prompter|>Who is Margaret Thatcher?

On the other hand, Thatcher was admired by many others for her leadership during the Falklands War, when she led Britain to swiftly defeat Argentina's claims on the Falkland Islands in 1982. suffix: This is a good question! There are many games that have been developed as free-to-play, but they rely on players to make money by purchasing high-cost virtual objects, such as weapons or other items that will aid them while playing the game. Companies like Riot Games, where the popular game “League of Legends” is produced, are able to use this model of free-to-play to create and promote their games while also selling brand-related, virtual products in similar ways to many online game developers. Free-to-play games are a growing trend, and you may even play some of them yourself soon, if you're curious to try!

It sounds like your question refers to so-called “free to play” video games. These are a subset of online games that are not free to download, but still “free to play”. This means that, as you say, players can access the games for free. However, the creators of these games, or the companies that host them, often make money from players through various ways.
Some popular ways that these companies make money are through in-game advertising (when players see ads while they're playing the game), sales of virtual items, and donations (in-game currency given voluntarily by players for price incentives). There are some cases where players can choose to pay a fee to play the game without any ads, without having to buy anything, etc., or to get more features, such as improved graphics or faster processing speeds.
It is also common for free to play games to offer additional services with an additional cost, such as downloadable content, permanent access to the game, or some other feature. Often, this additional cost is separate from the base game fee, so it only applies to those who pay for it.
If you're interested in learning more about the business and economics of free to play games, I recommend this good article: Infop

Tarot cards originated in the late 15th century as a card game, but by the 16th century had evolved into a medieval form of divination.  Tarot is drawn from universal archetypal symbols, and the cards can be interpreted to provide insight into various aspects of one's life and personality.  The earliest extant decks of tarot bear images that dated from about 1486, but many of these decks now reside in museums.  Tarot decks have had a resurgence in popularity since the late 1970s, partly owing to the success of the novel and motion picture "The Exorcist."

suffix: Good pizza starts with quality ingredients. Good pizza is a process that takes a bit of time, but it’s worth it! Don’t add too much flour or water, just enough to let it knead properly.  Then you want to let the dough rise, either in the refrigerator overnight or at room temperature.  Just cover it with plastic wrap, and wait until it doubles in size.  When the dough has risen, you can take it out and let it rest for a few minutes, so you can roll it out.  The most important part is to create a nice round pizza crust.  You can roll it out on a surface dusted with flour.  Once it’s rolled out, you can add toppings and other ingredients. prefix: <|prompter|>What kind of maintenance should I do on my road bike? I ride it almost every day.

<|prompter|>What kind of maintenance should I do on my road bike? I ride it almost every day.
<|assistant|>
suffix: First, get in the habit of removing your bike from its storage location in good time before you ride it.  Then, dust off the chain with a dry rag to remove any excess dirt, and lubricate it with dry lube or a water-based lubricant using a spray or applicator pump.  Check the spokes and the hubs for any loose or damaged parts, tighten them where needed, and inspect the tires for wear.  Finally, ensure that your brakes are functioning properly, and that there is sufficient air in the tires.  Just cleaning and lubing your bike regularly will help keep it in good shape for daily riding.

Good question! Here are some tips for your road bike:  - Daily routine: inspect the bike thoroughly, lubing the moving parts and cleaning the bike. - Weekly routine: inspect tires carefully, inspect frame and brakes for damage or needed repairs, check and maintain alignment, lubricate and adjust the chain, replace or clean the brake pads, and inspect the bike wheels and tires for slow leaks or damage. - Monthly routine: thoroughly clean the chain, clean and oil the cables, check brake shoe material for wear, and replace brake and gear cable housings. - Annually: inspect and replace inner tires or tube, replace worn tires and tubes, pneumatic valve and rim of front tire, and brake lever cords. Also lubricate brake and derailleur cable housings, replace worn brake linings and brake fluid, adjust and lubricate mechanical shifting cables, replace chain, chainrings, cogs, and chain keeper, and clean all components.

These records work together as a system of shared information or “distributed ledger” which is updated and maintained by all participants based on its network protocol. Each new block of data that is added to the blockchain records serves as an irrefutable reference point for the integrity of the entire history of the blockchain, as each new recording is essentially hashed and linked back to its preceding block in a chain of connections.

APR stands for “Annual Percentage Rate”, which is the cost of credit expressed as an annual rate. It is the total yearly cost of the loan, expressed as an annual rate, and is intended to make it clear what the cost of a loan will be over its entire term. The APR is generally calculated as a compound interest rate, calculating the total accumulated interest due through the end of the full term of the loan.
