suffix: The theory of humors comes from Hippocrates, and was a major part of medicine for about 2,000 years until the late 1800s. Humor theory says that there are four “elements” in the human body: fire, earth, air, and water. Different people were said to have an excess of one of those elements, and this resulted in different physical characteristics and personality traits. You might hear phrases like “choleric” or “melancholic”, which were used to describe the personality traits associated with a certain humor. So for example, a choleric person is someone who is fiery and hot-headed.

Humors were a classical theory of medicine dating back to ancient Greece.  The theory proposed that human health and personality are determined by a blend of four essential fluids or “humors” which needed to be kept in proper balance in order to maintain health.  These humors were identified as blood, yellow bile, black bile, and phlegm.  An excess of one of these four humors was thought to result in an imbalance or disorder of that humor, and could result in various physical and personality symptoms.  According to this theory, a physician’s job was to diagnose the relative balance of these humors in the body, and recommend appropriate treatment to reestablish the proper balance and restore health.  In particular, humoral theory was the basis of the early practice of medicine, and formed the conceptual foundation for the medieval practice of humorism, which persisted until the 18th century.  While modern medicine has abandoned humoral theory, it remains relevant as a historical example of how prevailing theories and beliefs can affect our understanding and comprehension of human physiology and health.

suffix: Sure, a “secured” credit card is just a type of credit card that requires you to put up some type of security to use the card, because you don’t have perfect credit or any credit history, for example.  You can use a program like CrediGuard, for example, to put up an asset like a car or a piece of jewelry so that you have something worth a lot of money to turn in if you default on any charges.  Using a secured credit card will help build your credit, so when you have a good history with the credit card company and establish a sound credit history, you can then apply for a credit card that doesn’t require that kind of asset as collateral.

Credit cards are plastic cards that let you borrow money from a bank to make purchases.  Secured credit cards allow you to borrow money, as with traditional credit cards, but they do this in a slightly different way.  Secured credit cards are sold directly through private companies that partner with lenders, and the companies usually charge you a low up-front fee when you first get a card.  Later, when you make purchases, you are charged interest on the money that you've borrowed, either at a fixed interest rate or a variable interest rate.  Secured credit cards are often targeted at people who don't qualify for traditional credit cards, so lenders often look closely at your past credit history when deciding whether or not to offer you a card.

prefix: <|prompter|>how long does bleu cheese take to ferment?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>how long does bleu cheese take to ferment?
<|assistant|>
suffix: Making and eating cheese is a fermentation process.  As milk sits out at room temperature, living surface bacteria begin to metabolize and decompose the sugars, fats, and proteins in the milk.  This bacterial fermentation creates lactic acid, which makes the milk more acidic and curdles the milk.  As the curds separate out from the whey, salt is added to the mix, the curds are formed into bricks, and they start to age.

It depends on the type of cheese you’re using and the process you’re using -- for a hard, pressed consistency, you can let it sit and ferment for weeks (or even months) until it gets to the texture and taste you’re looking for.  For softer, fresh cheeses, you’ll need to let them sit (and sometimes stir) for several hours.

suffix: Oh, two-factor authentication is a security measure used to prevent unauthorized access to computer systems and accounts.  The typical two-factor approach involves using both a password and a second authentication factor which must be provided in order to log in.  This second factor can either be a physical device (such as a hardware phone or USB token) that generates one-time passwords, or it can be some sort of secondary authentication channel such as a text message or phone call.  The idea is that it is more difficult for hackers to gain unauthorized access to an account if they do not have access to both the password and the second authentication factor.  Two-factor authentication is becoming increasingly common these days, in both personal accounts as well as for corporate systems.  It is considered a good security practice to enable two-factor authentication on all sensitive accounts.

It requires a second verification step after you enter your password to login, such as entering a code sent to your cell phone, or typing in a special key防屏蔽gonggen.compended on your physical credit card.  This extra security measure is designed to protect accounts from unauthorized access, since it is more difficult to guess another individual’s password or access their cell phone. suffix: Your immune system helps keep you healthy and safe from disease by recognizing and responding to foreign substances in the body called antigens. This allows the body to deactivate or get rid of antigens and infection.

Well, our body’s “immune system” is really a group of systems that work together to protect us against harmful substances such as bacteria and viruses.  There are several ways that our immune system helps fight off invaders, including increased heart rate, sweating, and inflammation.  In the case of viruses, our body first build up antibodies against them, which block the virus from entering new cells in our body.  Sometimes, the virus will be able to slip past the antibodies, and to kill cells in the human body, which is really harmful.  Many viruses will be successfully fought by our immune system, though, so we often have mild or even no symptoms from a viral infection at all.

prefix: <|prompter|>What is the difference between alternating current and direct current?

<|prompter|>Did Tesla invent alternating or direct current?

<|assistant|>Excellent question!  The answer is both!  Here is the basic story:  In the 1800s, two major competing systems of electricity were developed:  
-In Europe Thomas Edison promoted DC electricity, using battery power, while in the US Nikola Tesla promoted AC electricity, using generators and transformers. 
-Advantages of DC include simpler equipment with lower power applications, and also more efficient conversion to higher powers using various types of step up/step down transformers.  DC has less tendency to produce electromagnetic interference, and electrical circuits using DC can also be free-wheeling and self sustaining (AC circuits cannot, due to alternating current nature).  
-However the main advantage of AC is that it can more efficiently transmit energy over long distances using transmission lines (varying voltage with time, not spatially).  This led to the wide adoption of AC power over DC power for large scale power transmission and distribution.
<|prompter|>So Tesla promoted alternating current as the better option and it was adopted over direct current.

<|assistant|>Tesla’s AC electrical power and Edison’s DC electrical power both represent important breakthroughs in modern power generation.  It is certainly true that in the end Edison’s system of power was overshadowed by Tesla’s, but this was due to the tremendous advantages of AC electricity for transmission over long distances.  In fact, Tesla’s system of electricity was so powerful that it laid the foundation for the invention of AC motors and AC generators which are still the basis for modern power generation, even though the popular system of electricity uses AC power.  However Tesla’s AC generators had a drawback, in that they had to be fed a steady input of power, which is not ideal for providing electricity to households or businesses.  As a result, Edison’s DC generators were used to provide lower voltage and smaller scale power to homes and businesses.  Then AC generators were used to provide higher voltage and larger scale power to transmission and distribution.

prefix: <|prompter|>How does a presidential pardon work?

<|assistant|>Presidential pardons are granted to individuals who have been convicted of a crime or crimes. The power to grant private pardons is granted to the president by Article II of the U.S. Constitution. In order for a pardon to be granted, presidents must explain the reason for the pardon in writing. The president is prohibited from pardoning himself/herself or other federal officials who were involved in the criminal investigation or prosecution of the person who is seeking a pardon. The general popular meaning of the term is that a person who has been convicted of a crime is exonerated or released from punishment or penalty. However, the U.S. Constitution does not specify how this "forgiveness" is to be granted, as this power is granted to the president by Article II. When the president grants a pardon, it does not clear a person's records and it does not fully restore the person’s civil rights, but it is a formality that absolves the person of charges/sentences/punishment. Pardons are very rarely granted. There have only been a handful of individuals pardoned by President Obama.
<|prompter|>So the president can pardon anyone with a federal crime.

Draft cases faced further legal challenges after World War II, leading to significant reform of the draft structure; the Selective Service Act of 1948 and subsequent legislation established an alternate system of both military draft and volunteer army options, and the Selective Service challenge process was expanded to add support for conscientious objectors and affirm individual rights of protest and religious belief.

This can occur naturally, for example with oil spills or forest fires, or it can be the result of human activities like industry or road traffic.  Among the major chemical compounds that are harmful to human health are ground-level ozone and particulate matter, and these are usually produced by incident sunlight reacting with pollutants.  This is pretty common in example like metropolitan areas or industrial zones.  Exposure to air pollution can cause a number of serious health problems.  The most serious ones are heart and lung disease, as well as a variety of cancers.  Also, children who are exposed to high levels of air pollution may experience developmental delays.  For all of these reasons, it is extremely important to use clean energy sources, reduce the use of fossil fuels, reduce automobile emissions, and take steps to mitigate as much pollution as possible.

prefix: <|prompter|>What are the differences between regular yogurt and Greek yogurt?

<|prompter|>What are the differences between regular yogurt and Greek yogurt?
<|assistant|>
suffix: Greek yogurt is much thicker and creamier than regular yogurt, and has a higher protein content. Most Greek yogurts have a 3-5% fat content, while most regular yogurts are only around 2% fat. Greek yogurt is made by straining regular yogurt for approximately 6-10 hours, which separates the denser yogurt “curds” and draws out some of the liquids, leaving behind a firmer and thicker creamier yogurt product. In addition, most Greek yogurts are strained longer so as to remove almost all of the lactose and sugars, resulting in a high protein and low sugar yogurt. Finally, Greek yogurts generally have a much thicker and sharper yogurt “bite,” and have a slightly higher salt content. Regular yogurt is available in many delicious varieties and flavors, but Greek yogurt has a more limited, yet delicious, array of offerings including vanilla and plain.

Generally Greek yogurt is thicker, creamier and generally higher in protein and lower in carbohydrates than regular yogurt. It has a similar grading system to many other dairy products, and is typically sold in plain yogurt and flavored varieties. Greek yogurt is typically strained to remove excess water, so that it has about twice the protein content of regular yogurt. While Greek yogurt is richer and more dense, it still retains the probiotic bacteria of regular yogurt, providing health benefits including better bowel health and improved immune function. Historically Greek yogurt was created to provide a thicker and dairy-rich product to common yogurt, allowing it to be more flavorful and easier to use in baking and cooking, as well as have more nutritional value.

The fundamental principles of communism are based around common ownership of the means of production (including land and basic productive resources), economic equality, and collective organization of political power.  This involves a transition away from private property ownership and toward shared property ownership, and the establishment of a classless and stateless society which is purportedly more egalitarian and characterized by greater social equality.  Numerous variations and interpretations of these principles have emerged over time, along with correspondingly diverse reactions and assessments of these systems.

prefix: <|prompter|>What's a caprodon?

<|assistant|>A caprodon is a type of gelatin created from cleaned and dried skin and connective tissue of various animals, mainly from cows or pigs.  It is commonly used in food preparation, especially jellies and custards, and it is also used as a thickening agent in cosmetics and pharmaceuticals.  The name "capro" derives from the Latin word "capra", meaning goat, and the Greek word "odon", meaning tooth, referring to the skin and teeth of goats which were traditionally used in the production of this gelatin.  The name "caprodon" was proposed by the French chemist Vauquelin in 1809.

The caprodon grows to a maximum length of 40 cm, and has a laterally compressed greenish-brown body with a pointed snout and small eyes.  This fish is notable for its unusually long gut, which can extend up to 4/5 the total body length.  The caprodon is a voracious and swift predator, feeding mainly on small bony fish and crustaceans. prefix: <|prompter|>When should I be worried that my toddler is not talking?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>When should I be worried that my toddler is not talking?
<|assistant|>
suffix: Well, some toddlers learn to talk earlier than others, and there’s a wide variety of normal speech development. Generally, most children between 1 and 2 years old will be walking and babbling, and then after talking consonants appear, before 2 they start to say a variety of real phrases. Most toddlers will also typically say between 15 and 50 words by age 2. If you’re still not hearing understanding language from your child at 2, and you are otherwise confident that your child is sleeping and eating well and is growing and developing normally, it is probably worthwhile to consult your pediatrician. If your child has been silent since babyhood but otherwise seems to be developing normally, you should also speak to your doctor, but in this case it may be more helpful to speak to a speech-language pathologist as well, especially if your child also has difficulty following simple instructions and learning new skills. It may be that your child has just developed language slowly, or it may be that your child has a weak ability to process and use language. In either case, speaking to an educated specialist can help you to determine the most important steps to take.

Toddlers typically start to say their first words around 18 months of age, and can say around 50 words by the time they are 2 years old.  Early speech delay or “delayed speech” is generally considered to occur when a child fails to say any words by age 2, and a full communication delay is generally considered to occur when a child has not said any words by age 3.  Children with early speech delay may have difficulty hearing words or making sounds, may have a hearing impairment or autism spectrum disorder, or may simply be very quiet and uncommunicative.  Children with full communication delay generally suffer from a more severe condition which tends to be associated with intellectual disabilities, autism, or neurological disorders. The causes of early speech delay and full communication delay can often be determined with specialist medical assessment, but in many cases the cause is not clear.  In general, speaking delays are not considered normal or healthy, and should be investigated by a pediatrician or speech pathologist.

prefix: <|prompter|>Can you tell me about Alexander the Great and what he accomplished?

He inherited a vast empire from his father, and he pursued a series of military conquests that expanded the empire of Macedonia throughout the eastern Mediterranean Sea.  In 332 B.C., he led a military campaign into Persia, and shortly thereafter, he had conquered almost all of the Persian Empire.  Alexander led an enormous military force of almost one hundred thousand soldiers, and subjected almost every territory that he conquered to many years of war.  After he conquered Persia, he led his army south to the Indian subcontinent and conquered much of that region as well.  He died in 323, after more than two decades of almost constant military conflict.  One of Alexander's most famous deeds was founding a city in the Egyptian desert to serve as a trading center for the goods imported to and exported from Egypt. prefix: <|prompter|>How did humans start using salt and pepper?

<|assistant|>Using salt and pepper together is a tradition that has continued through many different cultures for a very long time.  The practice of adding taste-enhancing ingredients in general can actually be traced back to 12000 B.C., and salt and pepper were probably first used in combination together in Greece around the 4th century B.C.  It is thought that early sailors adopted the practice of mixing salt and pepper from their contact with Asian traders, and they introduced the combination to the Romans.  By the 14th century, the practice was common throughout Europe, and the history of human interactions with salt and pepper during this period is probably best documented in the writings of English writer Thomas Coryat.  Today, using salt and pepper together is such a widespread tradition that modern pepper mills include a salt shaker built into them.  Nowadays, the practice of using seasoning to enhance flavor continues to be popular around the world.
<|prompter|>When did it become common to have salt and pepper in shakers on the table?

<|assistant|>We have evidence that salt and pepper have been used together on food for many hundreds of years, so it is difficult to pinpoint exactly when the practice of eating with salt and pepper shakers first began.  In 1724, English author Thomas Coryat recorded the use of pepper shakers by the “Turks, Saracenenes, and other Eastern Princes”.  However, it wasn’t until the 19th century that it became a widespread practice in European kitchens.  By the 20th century, it was common to see salt and pepper shakers both on tabletops and in homes.  Even in modern times, many small villages continued to lack this convenient kitchen tool until very recently.  For example, the last Alaska bush pilots who reported flying to remote villages late in the 20th century described “pepper mason jars brought with them from homes in the lower 48 states”.  Today, it is particularly common to use the salt and pepper shakers to season certain kinds of food in specific parts of the world. <|prompter|>What countries produce the most salt?
<|assistant|>
suffix: The United States, China, India, and France are the four largest salt producers in the world.  Of these, China is in the lead, producing about 568 million tons of salt in 2012.  Salt is harvested from salt flats spread over a total area of 17 million square kilometers worldwide.  Salt is produced by evaporating seawater or saltwater lakes, and is primarily used by humans to season food.  It can also be produced from salt mines that contain large reserves of rock salt, and salt is a crucial ingredient in some industrial processes.  Smaller countries such as Bahrain and Belarus also produce significant amounts of salt.  Other types of salt besides table salt are also produced in various quantities, such as salt for use in heat and cold treatment, salt used as deicing agent for roads, and salt for use in saltwater aquariums.

The two major salt-producing countries worldwide are the United States and China.  The United States has been the top producer of salt for many years, and in 2014 it accounted for almost one-third of salt production worldwide, with 12 million metric tons.  In 2014, China accounted for 28% of salt production worldwide, surpassing the figure produced by the United States.  The top four salt-producing countries combined accounted for 64% of the total worldwide salt production in 2014. This number has fluctuated significantly in the past 10 years.  U.S. salt production has been in rapid decline since 2004, while China has consistently increased its salt production since 2005.  Other large contributing countries include Canada, Russia, and Egypt, the latter in particular being a major supplier of salt to North African countries.

prefix: <|prompter|>How do I repair knees on my jeans?

<|assistant|>Making small repairs on clothing such as jeans can be fairly easy, but you do need some sewing skills. First, choose a thick needle and strong thread, basically as strong as you can find. Then, after removing a section of thread, poke the needle in and out of the thread, going in one direction the first time, and then reversing for the second time half an inch away to weave the ends in together. The same process holds for needlework. Next, using a seam ripper, cut through the existing threads to separate the seam, holding the shorts with one hand, and the ripper with the other. Eliminate any loose threads, being careful not to prick yourself with the needle. Then, sew around the edges of the rip, making sure that it is even and straight. Lastly, sew back and forth across the seam to make it secure. These steps are for sewing simple on-the-cuff repairs, and should work for most basic situations.

suffix: When repairing clothes that are prone to snags, a canvas or thicker but soft nylon cloth is often recommended, as it is durable and means your garments will last longer. Heavier materials can also help to avoid damage to the original fabric. Often canvas comes in the form of a drop cloth, which is usually made of coarser fabric. Home improvement stores also sell pre-sewn patch kits for many different types of clothing. Lightweight fabrics such as cotton, much like a t-shirt fabric, are usually not recommended for general patching, as they are likely to damage the original fabric itself. Fiberfill fabric is also not recommended for garment repairs, as it can cause swelling and puckering of the new material and left unattended, may lead to permanent damage.

Fabrics also differ in texture, appearance, and air permeability, each of which can make a material more or less ideal for different purposes, based in part on personal preference. These are all qualities of a material's “hand” -- just like we refer to a cobbler as a “good hand” when he or she finishes a shoe to perfection. A “tight” hand is indicative of a soft and smooth texture that glides well, indicating a finely woven or finished fabric. Clothing with a “rough” hand combines a high thread count with a textured surface that bends well, making it a good option for activewear. Fabrics with a “loose” hand have a little play, making them better suited for loose-fitting clothing, whereas clothing made of a “hard” hand is rigid and slick, which is ideal for the performance demands of outer layers or garments such as raincoats and windbreakers. Cloth wafers also differ widely in air permeability, which describes how effective they are at blocking dust, dirt and moisture. prefix: <|prompter|>Is intelligence generally inherited?

<|assistant|>There’s a lot of debate about this question.  Many researchers believe that there is a genetic component: that is, that a given individual’s level of intelligence is partially determined by their genetic makeup.  Others are skeptical of that view, saying that environment is the major influence on an individual’s intelligence.  Of course, there’s a big overlap between the two views, so there’s some consensus that a mix of both factors contribute to an individual’s level of intelligence, rather than one of those factors being entirely responsible.  In any case, it’s important to remember that our intelligence is formed through many different parts of our brains, including our “gray matter” (which is responsible for thoughts, memories, and language) and our “white matter” (which is made up of nerve fibers that connect different areas of gray matter).
<|prompter|>Can they test the intelligence of a baby?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>Is intelligence generally inherited?

<|assistant|>There’s a lot of debate about this question.  Many researchers believe that there is a genetic component: that is, that a given individual’s level of intelligence is partially determined by their genetic makeup.  Others are skeptical of that view, saying that environment is the major influence on an individual’s intelligence.  Of course, there’s a big overlap between the two views, so there’s some consensus that a mix of both factors contribute to an individual’s level of intelligence, rather than one of those factors being entirely responsible.  In any case, it’s important to remember that our intelligence is formed through many different parts of our brains, including our “gray matter” (which is responsible for thoughts, memories, and language) and our “white matter” (which is made up of nerve fibers that connect different areas of gray matter).
<|prompter|>Can they test the intelligence of a baby?
<|assistant|>
suffix: There’s no one definition of “intelligence”.  However, a variety of tests can be used to assess many aspects of a child’s level of intelligence.  Some of these tests can be done during infancy, or as early as a few months.  For example, a simple “Baby IQ” test that gauges a baby’s visual interest in bright colors or sounds can be used to assess their general attention and alertness.  A “Baby GOAT” satellite test is an “open-ended” test that assesses a baby’s behavior using things like illustrations of animals or familiar tools.  There are also more “standardized” tests, like the Bayley Scales of Infant and Toddler Development, which are typically administered between ages 1 and 4 years.  While these later tests do yield valuable information about a child’s cognitive development, there is much debate about the use of these standardized tests on infants and toddlers, as the results are influenced by many factors beyond just intelligence, such as environment, cultural influences, and the attentiveness of the parent.

“Intelligence testing” is definitely something that researchers have looked at for very young children.  These tests are called “mentia” tests, and they’re usually designed for babies and young children between 3 and 5 years old -- although some researchers do focus on younger and older children as well.  Studies show that, even at a very young age, these tests can indicate which children will later end up scoring higher and lower on intelligence tests in adulthood.  Scientists think this is because measure of intelligence is partially related to the way the brain develops over time, especially in early childhood.

prefix: <|prompter|>Can you explain the origins of the USSR in depth, please?

<|assistant|>Sure, the USSR (also known as the Soviet Union), or Union of Soviet Socialist Republics was a nation in Europe and Asia from 1922 until 1991 when it was dissolved.  It was a communist political state founded on socialist principles by the Russian revolutionary Vladimir Lenin and centered around the major cities of Moscow and Saint Petersburg.  It was a geographically enormous country comprised of around 15 republics containing over 100 million citizens in its time, and was a major world power during much of the 20th century.  It played a pivotal role in the World Wars I and II and expanded its sphere of influence across Eastern Europe in the era of the Cold War.
<|prompter|>That is great, really in depth. If I needed to explain all of that in a paragraph, what key points should I make?

<|assistant|>The origins of the USSR are closely tied to the Russian revolution of 1917 and the rise of the communist Bolshevik party.  Under a volatile and unstable political climate in the aftermath of the First World War, the Bolsheviks called for an economic and political union with Eastern European nations.  The dissolution of the Austro-Hungarian Empire in 1918 provided the impetus for voluntary union under the Treaty of Brest-Litovsk, which became the embryonic union of Russia and Eastern Europe, which would later develop into the Soviet Union.  Economic and ideological pressures kept this multi-national state very fragile during much of the 20th century, and it faced severe economic difficulty, internal political conflict, and external ideological challenges to its existence throughout this period.  The USSR fell apart in the wake of the geopolitical shifts following communism in Eastern Europe, the collapse of the Soviet empire, and the growing realization of economic and social inefficiencies in the system that eventually proved economically unsustainable.
<|prompter|>Can you tell me what countries were formed after the USSR dissolved?

<|assistant|>The breakup of the USSR led to the re-establishment of sovereign nation-states including Russia, Ukraine, Belarus, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Kazakhstan, Moldova, Tajikistan, Kyrgyzstan, and many more in a widespread process of independence.   Here are a few key countries that were formed around the 21st-century transition from Soviet governance to independent nations:  The Russian Federation is the largest successor state, incorporating nearly one fifth of the former Soviet Union's landmass and speaking more than 80% of the total population of citizens; Kazakhstan, Uzbekistan, Tajikistan, Kyrgyzstan, and Turkmenistan as well as Armenia and Azerbaijan all became independent states in this era, continuing many of the economic, political and cultural traditions of the Soviet history; Georgia emerged as a free state not long after the dissolution, and announced its independence in 1991; Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania emerged as independent nations after the breakup of the USSR, having been annexed by Nazi Germany at the outbreak of the Second World War in 1941 and re-annexed by the USSR significantly later. prefix: <|prompter|>How much activity should a child get a day?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>How much activity should a child get a day?
<|assistant|>
suffix: It’s difficult for me to give a specific answer to this question, as it varies from child to child, and also depends on many other factors, such as the child’s health and livelihood, as well as things like the climate and time of day. I think some general guidelines are that children can benefit from 30 to 60 minutes of physical activity each day, and that children generally experience higher levels of energy from moderate to vigorous physical activity, such as running, walking, jumping, and playing outside. Finally, I would point out that a child’s activity level can likely be monitored based on things like their energy level, stamina, and alertness, and the child’s pediatrician can be a valuable source of information and guidance for parents trying to encourage physical activity in their children.

The answer depends on the age of the child, but according to the American Academy of Pediatrics, children under age three shouldn’t spend more than two hours at a time in front of a screen, including TV, DVDs, and computer, and children ages three to five shouldn’t watch more than one to two hours of screen time a day, including both TV and computer. The amount of time spent watching TV and using computers should be in moderation, given that TV and computer games can make children lose touch with the real world and become more sedentary. Children ages six to eighteen should average only one to two hours of screen time a day, although less when kids are younger, and more before the school day ends. The AAP also recommends getting kids involved in a range of healthy activities and outside play, which can include things like dancing, climbing trees, walking, or playing other active games, in order to encourage them to be active, and help them develop important physical, emotional, social, and intellectual skills. For more information, please visit the American Academy of Pediatrics at www.healthychildren.org or call (800) AAP-CHILD (800-227-5453).

suffix: Anthroposophy is a philosophical system developed by the Austrian philosopher Rudolf Steiner in the first half of the 20th century. In particular, the use of the decimal numeral system for expressing numbers is seen as an ideal vehicle for exploring the relationships between the various esoteric forces in the universe.  The theosophical movement seeks to synthesize scientific, religious, and mystical ideas and understand the universe as a dynamic network of living spiritual forces.  In this context, the symbolism of the decimal system is believed to represent an important symbolic key to understanding the universe and human spiritual development.

prefix: <|prompter|>How are trees made into lumber?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>How are trees made into lumber?
<|assistant|>
suffix: Trees are typically grown and harvested once they are between 20 - 40 years old. The trees are transported to a lumber mill, where they are cut into lumber pieces and/or sawn into smaller boards. The lumber pieces are processed and dried (seasoned), then are cut into standard board sizes. After the initial mass-processing, the boards are ready to be sanded, stained and finished prior to being sold.

The process of making lumber can be complex, and it can involve a variety of different processes. But basically it usually involves cutting down a tree, removing its branches, and cutting it into the desired finished lumber products. The tree is also usually cut so that it is evenly matched and grows in the same direction. These tree sections can then be processed in various ways to produce a wide assortment of different types of finished lumber products.

prefix: <|prompter|>How do I get rid of acne?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>How do I get rid of acne?
<|assistant|>
suffix: Great question!  Acne is caused by a combination of skin bacteria known as P. acnes and the body’s overproduction of sebum, an oily substance that helps regulate the skin’s oil glands.  Acne often occurs when a mixture of severe irritation, bacteria, and clogged pores occur, creating blemishes and whiteheads on the skin.  The best way to treat acne is through the combination of proper acne care and a healthy, balanced lifestyle.  Here are some tips to help with acne care:

The best treatment for acne involves a combination of medication and natural skin care to help reduce breakouts and prevent new blemishes.  Some of the most effective treatments include keeping your skin clean, avoiding picking at blemishes, using a gentle and non-drying cleanser, and applying non-prescription retinoids to reduce oil production.  Over-the-counter topical treatments and creams can also be very effective for reducing blemishes, these contain an antibiotic or anti-inflammatory, and can often reduce redness and help with scars. If you are still having a lot of breakouts despite these treatments, it is important to see a doctor, as there are many other effective medical options. Cognitive-behavioral therapy is also an effective way to cope with acne and help prevent new break-outs, it helps promote positive body image and emotional well-being, and can lead to significant improvements in self-esteem.

suffix: One good method to collect rainwater for reuse is to set up a rain barrel.  A rain barrel is basically just a large plastic or metal container that is set under the eves of your roof to catch the rain runoff.  You can then use this collected rainwater for things like watering plants or laundry, as long as it has been purified or disinfected.  This is a very efficient and low cost way to harvest rainwater.  It is a very green solution as well, since collecting rainwater has minimal environmental impact.  There are additional ways to collect rainwater, such as setting up rainwater catchment tanks or cisterns, but a rain barrel is a very cost-effective and straightforward method.  Hope this helps!  Thanks for asking :)

This is a great question, and a very important concern in many parts of the world!  There are many approaches to rainwater collection and reuse, depending on a variety of factors such as the climate, available space, and existing infrastructure.  One of the most common and straightforward methods is to simply collect water directly from rooftops using various types of rainwater collection systems.  Another approach is to capture rainfall from broader areas using cisterns or ponds, or using constructed drainage systems or swales.  Whichever approach is most suitable and feasible for your specific circumstances, there are many helpful guides and educational resources available which can provide further useful information on the topic.

prefix: <|prompter|>I found these tips on how to avoid debt, but the author didn't go into detail. Could you explain these in more detail? '1. Build an Emergency Fund · 2. Choose a Spending Plan · 3. Stick to a Savings Routine · 4. Pay Your Full Credit Card Bill Each Month

<|assistant|>Sure, here is more detailed info about each of the four points that the author of that article mentions:  1. Build an Emergency Fund · Emergency funds can be set up in a variety of ways depending on how much money you need, and how quickly you need it. Some methods of establishing an emergency fund include:
- Creating a savings account
- Storing money in an accessible safe
- Opening a savings bond
- Savings bond
- Paying your own credit card bill versus allowing your merchant to do so
- Opening a credit union account Upon setting up an emergency fund, you should make a commitment to consistently contribute in an amount that you can comfortably manage. This is an important reminder of your larger life goal to become an expert of living debt free.
2. Choose a Spending Plan · Many different methods exist for establishing a spending plan. Some methods include:
- Using Cash Only
- Paying Momentum
- Tracking Your Spending
- Using the "Kiss Method" Once you have developed your spending plan, you should ensure that you keep to it. Make small changes to your plan as you work toward your overall goal of living debt-free.
3. Stick to a Savings Routine · Establishing a regular savings routine is key to being debt free in the long run. Doctors of psychology recommend establishing this savings routine at the same time every day. This routine can be done using the bank or credit union ATM, or it can be as low-tech as using toilet paper that features a roll of money. Setting up this savings commitment on a daily basis breaks the work into manageable chunks instead of confronting the entirety of your savings strategy all at once.
4. Pay Your Full Credit Card Bill · Instead of paying only the minimum due, aim to pay more than the minimum due when paying off your credit card bills each month. This ensures that you have fewer credit card payments during the month, and has a much smaller impact on your credit rating. Avoid paying with cash, as this puts your spending decisions outside your immediate budgeting control. Financial experts state that credit card borrowing statistics show that you should strive to have less than 2 percent of your available credit total balance unpaid. If you are struggling financially, seek the help of a professional to help you get your finances back on the right track.

prefix: <|prompter|>How do you use a bamboo steamer basket?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>How do you use a bamboo steamer basket?
<|assistant|>
suffix: The bamboo steamer basket is a useful kitchen tool for cooking many different types of foods, particularly vegetables.  To use the basket, first fill it with vegetables of your choice, spreading them out in a single even layer.  Then fill the boiling water pan or wok with water to a depth of about 2 inches, and place this beneath the steaming basket containing the vegetables.  Heat the water until it boils, then clamp the steamer lid in place, covering the vegetables.  Steam vegetables for about 15 to 20 minutes, until they are soft and tender.

Bamboo steamer baskets are commonly used for cooking a wide variety of different dishes and foods.  They are designed for use with a steamer or stovetop-type electric steamer appliance, or you can also use them over a pot of boiling water on the stove.  The bamboo baskets allow food to be steamed or steamed and boiled at the same time, resulting in moist and tender dishes.  The baskets can be used to cook foods that would normally require steaming, such as vegetables.  The open design also allows for cooking tasks where food is first prepared in another way, or that require oil, like certain types of fried rice dishes.

prefix: <|prompter|>Can you outline Mao Tse Tung principle on, no investigation, no right to speak?

<|prompter|>Can you outline Mao Tse Tung principle on, no investigation, no right to speak?
<|assistant|>
suffix: Mao Zedong strongly advocated for strict adherence to his political ideologies in Communist China, called Maoism, which followed the communist principles of Marxism-Leninism.  The principle on which no investigation, no right to speak was based is reflected in several key texts, including Mao Tse Tung's "Problems of Strategy in China’s Revolutionary War" and "The Domestic War'”:

Mao Tse Tung did not allow any criticisms or public discussions of various political and social issues or policies, and the government was supreme and clear in this authoritarian approach.  All public statements and investigations were highly regulated and restricted, similar to an official party line that could not be challenged.  Debate and discussion among the public was strictly controlled and censored, which meant that the party leadership made all critical decisions and had full control over all public communications.  This strict system of censorship and control, known as “mind control”, was designed to eliminate any questions or opposition, so that there could be no public challenge to the official party administration.

In 2020 TikTok ultimately agreed to a US government purchase and restructure of the app as a condition of being allowed to continue operations in the US.

There are many different types of coloring utensils that are both safe and effective for younger children. Some of the most popular options include colored pencils, colored pens, and colored markers. prefix: <|prompter|>Nothing I seem to do works for getting rid of these tiny black ants in my apartment. Can you offer some specific ways for me to try getting rid of them? I have tried some oil sprays and keeping my place as clean as I can.

<|assistant|>I would certainly recommend taking preventative steps to eliminate crawling spaces and access points to eliminate entry contamination from the outside. This means sealing pry-points in the floor and walls, as well as recycling and re-sealing any holes or gaps in windows, doors, and other exterior enclosures. There are also a few general tips that are highly effective in preventing ant invasions: clean all surfaces of food residues and trash regularly; eliminate any standing liquids where ants can get access; keep sinks, counters and counterspans clean and dry; and avoid damp conditions, such as leaving water, wet dishes or pet foods sitting out over time. In addition, regular sanitation with organic ant-baiting products is highly effective in eradicating existing colonies.

In addition, regular sanitation with organic ant-baiting products is highly effective in eradicating existing colonies.
<|prompter|>What are the names of some ant-baiting products?
<|assistant|>
suffix: The most popular and effective ant-baiting substances are boric acid and ant-cakes. Ant-cakes are granular mixtures of food-powders and boric acid that are an effective, scientifically-proven way of repelling and controlling ant colonies. Home ant-baiting treatments typically use either directly-purchased ant-cakes or mixtures of boric acid and an attractive food-powder, like proteins and sugars.

The two most common organic ant-baiting products are boric acid and sugar-based baits. Boric acid is derived from the mineral borax, and ant-bait formulas usually contain one or more of the following: boric acid powder, borax, sugar, nutritional acids, and essential oils. Some ant-baiting products may also contain toxic nest poison, such as boric acid. Toxins in ant-bait products are not meant for continuous, extended use, and can cause harmful side-effects when used in this manner. Most ant-bait formulas are meant to be used for only a single treatment, and direct contact with the ant-bait is not recommended for normal use.

prefix: <|prompter|>Why don't casinos have clocks?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>Why don't casinos have clocks?
<|assistant|>
suffix: Hmm that’s a rather interesting and thought-provoking question! The general consensus is that casinos are designed and operated to maximize profits for the casino operators, and providing clocks in the casinos would present an undesirable disincentive for gambling past a certain point.  Casinos also seek to foster a sense of timelessness and escapism within the casino environment, which helps to maintain the sense of thrill and excitement within the casinos.  Therefore, casinos are typically deliberately designed to be somewhat deliberately counter-intuitive and disorienting, with no clocks or windows, and to provide an endless flow of distraction and entertainment to keep gamblers engaged and spending time and money within the casinos.

That is a common misconception, actually casinos do have clocks.  Casinos typically have hundreds of clocks prominently displayed in the casinos to orient players and staff regarding time and scheduling, for the purpose of increasing fairness and maintaining responsible betting habits. Clocks are often used as design features in casinos for a deliberate aesthetic effect related to the perception of time, and are intended to create a sense of adventure and excitement as part of the casino experience.  Casinos often feature large clocks above the main entrance, and there are usually many digital clocks and analog clock faces mounted on gaming tables and other prominent locations throughout the casino floor.  A summit held by the American Gaming Association in July 2019 made a statement urging casinos to 1) Establish a casual and equitable environment, 2) Maintain fairness and integrity of game play, 3) Respect the rights of patrons through clarity, honesty and good faith. Part of this includes providing clear visibility of time and scheduling for the purpose of supporting responsible gaming behaviors, and many states have regulations about clock displays in casinos. Casinos also have staff Support Service Specialists employed throughout the casino floor whose job is specifically to help patrons monitor their time and make decisions about when to stop playing and budget their expenditures. <|prompter|>How to make a box mandir at home?
<|assistant|>
suffix: First, you’ll need to make a basic box mandir by drawing a square on one side of the cardboard sheet, and cutting out the square piece.  Spray the cut-out square piece with glue and place it facing upward on the box mandir frame.  Then you can add colorful pieces to the top of the box mandir frame, using glue to affix them to the frame and wooden stick or dowels to attach them.  Next, you can add paper or cloth to the inside of the square panel piece, trim it to size, and glue it over the paper already on the box mandir frame with a 1⁄2-inch border all around the inside edges of the frame cutout.  Then, you can glue the outer decorative trimmings around an outline for the deity’s picture on the inside of the box mandir frame.  When the glue is dry, glue the deity’s picture plane on the box mandir frame.  You can then decorate the deity’s picture with eyes and other elements using glue and black pen.

A mandir is a Hindu temple, and the term is sometimes used interchangeably with “temple.”  A mandir is generally a fairly simple structure, similar to a house, where the focus is more on spiritual aspects than elaborate decorations.  In general, a mandir is a small building, with a main room used for religious purposes, and additional rooms used for storage or other purposes.  Mandalis are typically built from inexpensive materials like wood or stone.  So building a mandir will mostly just involve familiar construction methods, such as cutting lumber, assembling panels from wood, or pouring cement.

prefix: <|prompter|>Can you explain what 'noob gains' means exactly? From what I understand, its the muscle you put on right when you start lifting weights.
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>Can you explain what 'noob gains' means exactly? From what I understand, its the muscle you put on right when you start lifting weights.
<|assistant|>
suffix: The phrase “noob gains” is a slang term that is often used to refer to muscle gains that come from weightlifting but are shallow or fleeting, as opposed to “real gains” that are from using more challenging exercises and lifting heavier weights over time. Basically, it’s a way to describe the way in which people who start using weightlifting exercise often make initial gains in muscle mass before starting to plateau after only a few weeks or months.

Sure noob gains aren't technically muscle, but are a temporary increase in strength people experience at the start of a new training program. They're easiest to notice in people who are brand new to weightlifting, but can happen to even experienced lifters if their training has been interrupted or changed. Noob gains generally go away after a year or so in a steady training routine, but temporary gains don't necessarily mean that a lot of muscle growth is occurring. Instead, your body brings other systems into play to support an increase in strength, and many noob gains happen through an improvement in neural (brain and nervous system) activity. One way to keep the gains is, of course, to keep training consistently!

Climate mitigation refers to efforts to reduce the sources or enhance the sinks of greenhouse gases in the Earth's atmosphere. Objective climate mitigation seeks to stabilize and eventually reduce concentrations of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere, in order to reduce the magnitude and rate of climate change.  In general, mitigation strategies can be roughly divided into three broad categories: reducing emissions, increasing sinks, and adaptation.  In practice, it is often necessary to employ a combination of these three categories of strategies simultaneously for comprehensive climate mitigation. Systematic observation of the climate system can play an important role in understanding the effectiveness of different mitigation strategies in various contexts.

prefix: <|prompter|>Who were some of the other early explorers other than Christopher Columbus?

<|assistant|>Columbus was certainly among the earliest European explorers who traveled to the New World, but by the 15th century there were a number of European voyages and explorations being undertaken around the world.  Perhaps some of the most famous journeys after Columbus included the voyages of Ferdinand Magellan and Vasco Nunez de Balboa in the 16th century.  Magellan was the first to sail completely around the world, with the Spanish royal fleet navigating southern latitudes in South America in a failed effort to find a westward route to the Spice Islands of Southeast Asia.  Magellan himself did not survive the voyage, as he and his fleet were shipwrecked and killed   in the Philippines.  A few years later, Vasco Nunez de Balboa would be the first European to reach the Pacific Ocean.   Balboa crossed the Isthmus of Panama, the narrow strip of land that connects North and South America, but faced execution over charges of rebellion, before ultimately being pardoned by the Spanish crown.
<|prompter|>Can you tell me more about the life of Vasco Nunez de Balboa?

<|assistant|>Balboa was a Spanish explorer who became the first European to reach the Pacific Ocean.  He was born in AD 1475 to Peruvian coastline near Venta Cruz, but as a young man he moved to Hispaniola (modern-day Dominican Republic) to take on a job as a goldsmith.  He spent much of his youth as a fortune hunter in pursuit of gold and silver, but also became a ship’s officer and experienced sailor.  By 1513, Balboa had been enlisted in a series of Spanish expeditions to Central America, and after failed attempts to find a way to use the Pacific Ocean to reach the Spice Islands of Southeast Asia, his crew was able to cross the Isthmus of Panama in 1513.  Balboa claimed the river he’d found on the other side of the isthmus as the Pacific, and would go on to be the leader of the Spanish conquest of the Caribbean.  Balboa was taken prisoner by the Spanish governor Pedro Arias Dávila and imprisoned in chains, with Balboa eventually facing trial and execution for charges of rebellion.  However, after receiving a negative response from the Spanish royalty for the decision, Balboa was ultimately spared from death and exiled.
<|prompter|>Were there any other important explorers other than Columbus, Magellan, and Balboa?

<|assistant|>Columbus and Magellan were certainly among the most famous for their voyages and explorations in the 15th and 16th centuries, but there were a number of other stories of exploration and travel at this time, both within and outside the Americas.  For example, after Columbus’s voyages, Portuguese ships would next cross the Atlantic Ocean, and in 1488 they claimed Brazil as a colony.  In addition, the “Age of Discovery” is also associated with the navigating attempts of the Italian explorer Giovanni Caboto, better known as John Cabot.  In 1497, Cabot led an expedition from England to North America, claiming the land for Great Britain, but he would die soon after the expedition terminally illness, never returning home.  A permanent British colony was established at Roanoke Island, but a second and later colony failed to survive in 1590.   While these were English explorations, Italian explorers Giovanni da Verrazzano and Amerigo Vespucci had also been successful in repeating Columbus’s voyages to the New World.  Vespucci took particular interest in mapping these new territories, eventually publishing a book, Mundus Novus, which described his voyages.

prefix: <|prompter|>How do airbags work?

<|prompter|>Aren't there airbags in other locations in newer cars?
<|assistant|>
suffix: This is true -- as part of the effort to reduce injuries and fatalities during a collision, many vehicles include airbags in destinations that are less prone to injury, like on the backs of the front seats, or even the front seats themselves.  Very small and lightweight cars do not generally include airbags in these locations, but most other vehicles definitely have them.

Unfortunately, in the past couple years there have been some serious and even deadly side effects associated with airbags.  Most of these side effects have been large enough to cause an airbag to needlessly deploy during minor accidents.  After several investigations, manufacturers found that the most common problems were actually coming from manufacturing variations in the sensors, which reacted to very slight changes in the vehicle's speed and location.  Called “pre-deployment,” these sensors now use a smaller amount of gas when deployed.  This has lowered the number of injuries that are caused by airbags, however problems related to pre-deployment sensors are still occasionally being reported.

The benefit is paid out on the death of the policy holder, so term insurance coverage typically provides valuable protection during the critical early and middle years of life. Current demographics indicate that the average life insurance purchaser is about 45 years old, and about two thirds of the purchase population is purchasing term life insurance. Term life insurance coverage is often paired with more permanent life insurance coverage, such as a whole life insurance or universal life insurance policy. These choices offer various levels of protection and cash value savings that can be used to finance financial or emergency needs.

Term life insurance is for a specific length of time. While coverage generally cannot be canceled after the first payment, some policies do allow you to renew or extend a policy before the term has expired. Missing a payment or premiums means that the coverage period can end early. Term life insurance is generally cheaper than other types of life insurance. These policies may not be as flexible as other plans, but they do offer a degree of long-term financial security. <|prompter|>How do I get over shyness in social situations?
<|assistant|>
suffix: Shyness is a real and pervasive challenge, and there are a variety of things you can do to help overcome it. Perhaps the most important step is to reduce the role of your inner critic.  Most shy people have learned to fear social situations, and to be constantly worried about what other people will think of them.  This inner critic, even unspoken, is very limiting and will make you less confident and less comfortable in social settings.  As you work to diminish your inner critic, you will become more aware of your values and opinions, which will help you reflect on some of the more extreme views of the world that others may hold about you.  You will look at their perspectives not with suspicion, but with empathy, and this will help you feel more confident and at ease.

Shyness is a normal and natural feeling.  The causes of shyness are varied, but shyness can come from insecure attachment styles, an excessive fear of being judged or rejected, or from other feelings such as anxiety or anxiety-related disorders.  In general, however, you don’t need to worry too much about shyness or wasting time trying to “get over” shyness.  Instead, being shy is simply a characteristic of your personality, and there’s no need to worry about it too much, or to try to change your basic personality.

These effects allow the astronauts (and passengers of spacecraft in the case of interstellar travel) to experience relatively brief timescales due to these shifts, even when compared with the timescales of events on Earth.  Thanks to the relativity of time, it is possible to travel into space and return to Earth while experiencing only a relatively short period of time.

Time dilation effects, such as the slowdown of clocks at high speeds, are used in various technologies.  For example, GPS satellites rely on accurate timing to transmit precise astronomical position information, which is necessary for delivery of active navigation and other location sensitive services in vehicles and handheld electronics.  Time dilation effects are also the basis for recent and ongoing research into the development of enhanced space travel capabilities, such as locally slowed time on board spacecraft for more efficient space travel and the gravitational time dilation effects that enable the possibility of time travel to the past.

prefix: <|prompter|>What is bananas foster and how can I make it at home?

<|prompter|>What is bananas foster and how can I make it at home?
<|assistant|>
suffix: Bananas Foster is a dish made with bananas, sugar, brown sugar, butter, and dark rum.  It’s typically burned on top with a set of kitchen torches, which adds a special flavoring and produces a very delicious dessert.  To make banana foster at home yourself, start by whipping 1/3 cup of butter, 2/3 cup dark brown sugar, and a generous pinch of salt in a medium pan over medium heat.  When the butter has melted, add 3 or 4 bananas, cut into 1-inch thick slices.  Cook for about 10 minutes, or until the bananas are soft.  Add 2 tbsp. of dark rum, a pinch of cinnamon, and a pinch of nutmeg, and cook for 2-3 minutes more, until the seasoning and alcohol have been absorbed by the bananas.  Sprinkle 2 tbsp. of peanuts on top, and continue to cook for another few minutes, until the peanuts are soft.  Finally, use a kitchen torch to flame the top of the dish, slightly tilting the pan to evenly flame the bananas on top.  Serve immediately, and enjoy!

Bananas Foster is an often-caramelized dessert that’s made by combining bananas, dark rum, and brown sugar, and then cooking until it’s caramelized and flambéed. <|prompter|>What is a cyberstalker?

suffix: A cyberstalker is someone who uses the Internet to stalk another person, as opposed to stalking someone in person.  Cyberstalking means that the stalker uses email, online forums, social media, chat roulette, etc. to harass or threaten the victim.  Typical forms of cyberstalking behavior include the following:  spreading rumors about the victim, making harassing phone calls or text messages, publishing or posting information that is extremely personal or offensive to the victim, hacking into the victim’s personal accounts, and even attempts to “friend” or “befriend” the victim in order to use them for malicious purposes.  Cyberstalking is a serious crime, and the FBI now distinguishes between different forms of online harassment (including cyberstalking).  Many states have now passed laws specifically addressing online harassment, including potential penalties for offenders, and improving support for victims of cyberstalking.

Cyberstalking refers to the use of technology or the internet to stalk an individual and harass them. Stalking involves persistent unwanted attention or contact that is disruptive, alarming, threatening, harassing, and sometimes violent. Stalking may also involve sending, leaving, or posting unwanted communications, comments or images, making repeated phone calls to contact the victim, following a person, hacking into a computer or electronic device to gain private information, or other intrusions into the victim’s privacy with the purpose of causing emotional distress. Cyberstalking adds computer technology and the internet to the stalking phenomenon. Cyberstalking can take the form of online harassment in which the stalker uses the internet to send harassing or threatening messages, post harmful information, make derogatory comments or video recordings, or set up false online profiles with the purpose of observing the victim’s online activities.

Silkscreen, also known as silk-screen, screenprinting or serigraph is an industrial process used to reproduce images or graphics onto a substrate. It is often used as a method of printing T-shirts. Raised beds can significantly improve your chances of having a successful garden. They elevate your vegetables above the surface of the ground, which keeps soil water from draining away and helps to avoid problems with soil-borne pests. Also, raised beds let you grow more produce in a given area, since you can plant your seeds and vegetables closer together. To prepare a raised garden bed, begin by marking out the beds on a flat area on your property. You can use stones, boards, or bricks to create the bed; it should be at least 2 feet wide. Then fill your beds with rich, well-drained soil, and add some fertilizer, such as compost, to each bed. Now you’re ready to get planting! :)

Like all citizens and residents, federally recognized American Indian tribes are subject to certain federal tax obligations.  However, special status under law for sovereign tribal nations means that they, like local governments, are generally exempt from federal income and payroll tax withholding requirements.

prefix: <|prompter|>How do I roast corn perfectly on a grill?

<|assistant|>There are a few key things to keep in mind for successful grilled corn.  First, make sure you preheat the grill to a medium heat, and lightly grease the grates with some oil.  Once the grill is hot, place the corn directly on the grill, close the lid, and let cook for about 10-15 minutes.  During this time, turn the corn regularly for even cooking.  You can brush the corn with a bit of oil during cooking to add some additional flavor, and finally once the corn is nicely browned all over, remove from the grill and season generously with salt and pepper.  Serve hot.  How this advice works in practice will depend on your specific grill and cooking preferences, so feel free to adjust as needed.  I hope this helps!
<|prompter|>Should I roast it inside the husk, or remove the husk before cooking?

<|assistant|>You can certainly choose either method.  If roasting with the husk on, simply generously brush the husked corn with some oil and salt before placing on the hot grill as described above.  The husk will protect the corn during cooking, which helps keep the corn moist and delicate.  If you prefer to cook the corn without the husk, you may want to lightly brush the corn kernels with oil before placing on the hot grill.  This will help to brown and flavor the corn kernels.  In either case, it is recommended to salt and pepper the corn once finished cooking.  I hope this helps!
<|prompter|>Should I season the corn with anything besides salt and pepper?

<|assistant|>Yes, it is certainly fine to play around with some additional flavors if you wish.  Some common seasoning options include paprika, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, oregano, chili powder, and shredded cheese.  Simply add these to taste before serving, either during cooking on the grill or once finished cooking.  However, it is certainly fine to simply enjoy the corn plain, as well.  I hope this helps!

<|prompter|>How do I select the best, freshest corn?

suffix: There are a few simple indicators which can be used to select high quality, fresh corn at the grocery store or farmer’s market.  Start by choosing corn with bright, colorful husks and uniformly green stalks.  Next, gently squeeze the side of the husk to check for plump, firm kernels; ideal corn will be filled with lots of tender, juicy kernels.  Finally, and perhaps most importantly, simply smell the corn to check for a sweet, fragrant, fresh aroma.  If you are able to smell a nice corn fragrance, this is an excellent indicator of fresh, ripe corn.  However, fresh corn does lose its desirable aroma as it ages, and the quality will significantly decrease after 2-3 days, so it is recommended to select corn while in peak condition.  I hope this helps!

When selecting corn for grilling, try to choose freshest, sweetest ears of corn you can find.  Corn kernels become sweeter and more tender as the corn matures, so the younger the corn, the tougher and less sweet the kernels will be.  For this reason, older corn may actually work better for baking or boiling, but grilling is best with the youngest, sweetest corn.  Additionally, try to select corn with nice, milky kernels and a firm, hearty texture.  Dried out or shriveled kernels are a sign the corn is past its prime.  Avoid any corn with cuts, cracks, or other blemishes, as these areas may cause kernel spoilage during cooking.  Finally, be sure to store corn in a cool, dry place whenever possible before grilling, as too warm or moist of conditions will cause the corn to spoil more quickly.  I hope this helps!

To get rid of them, I recommend two approaches: First, you should try to control their access to your home. Ants typically travel in and out of houses through various cracks and seams. Try caulking or filling in the cracks with spray foam, or using sticky tape and glue to secure any entry points you find. Second, you can use baits and ant poisons to repel and kill those that do get in, if you can’t control their access. The baits are available at most hardware stores, and there are also sprays that you can use outdoors and inside your home.

Ants are generally not a serious threat, but if you want to get rid of them, you can try leaving dishes unwashed in the kitchen, keeping counters and floors dry and clean, and exterminating them using specially formulated ant bait or ant traps.  If ants are a common problem where you live, make some extra effort to keep your kitchen as clean as possible, and talk to an expert if the problem persists.

NATO is an international military alliance between several North American and European countries.  The stated goal of NATO is to "help safeguard the freedom and security" of the member countries, by means of political and military cooperation.  The main focus of NATO's military policies is the provision of mutual defense against potential attacks from outside the alliance.

suffix: Earwax is produced inside tiny glands, called ceruminous glands, which are located inside the outer ear, around the eardrum.  These glands typically produce less than a teaspoon of earwax per day.

Earwax is produced primarily in glands in the skin behind the ear canal, or the outer portion of the ear.  The wax drains down towards the neck, eventually melting due to body heat.  There are also special glands in the ear canal that secrete an additional layer of earwax, but overall, it’s mostly produced behind the ears.  People tend to notice some earwax when it dries up, as it can harden, affecting the ear’s sense of hearing and causing discomfort.

But keep in mind that relationships are a two-way street, and if you try to behave in ways that make people want to get close to you, others will very likely enjoy your company and want to remain your friend. The actors Mila Kunis and Ashton Kutcher have raised over $30 million for Ukrainain refugees fleeing the country amid the ongoing Russian invasion.  The couple, who first rose to fame on the sitcom "That '70s Show," previously vowed to match all donations to the fundraiser up to $3 million.  In a video shared on Kutcher's Instagram, the couple thanked supporters for their donations. "Over 65,000 of you donated," said Kunis. "We are overwhelmed with gratitude for the support." She pointed out that while the donations will not solve the crisis, "our collective effort will provide a softer landing for so many people as they forge ahead into their future of uncertainty."  
"We are going to do everything we can to ensure that the outpouring of love that came from you all as a part of this campaign finds the maximum impact with those in need," added Kutcher.  "As funding continues to come in, we are going to treat every dollar as if it is being donated out of our pocket." 
The International Organization for Migration says that since the Russian invasion of Ukraine began in late February, over 3 million refugees have fled the country, including at least 1.5 million children.  Many of them have found refuge in neighboring countries, including Romania, Moldova, and Poland. And 6.48 million people have been internally displaced, forced to leave their homes to search for safety elsewhere in the country. prefix: <|prompter|>How much sleep do newborn babies get on average?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>How much sleep do newborn babies get on average?
<|assistant|>
suffix: Babies sleep an average of 14 to 18 hours a day when they’re young.  If they’re sleeping deeper, they tend to sleep for around 16 hours a day.  Another thing to consider is that when newborns are awake, they usually just sleep or nurse.  Often they only have chunks of awake time interspersed with sleep in the first week after birth.

It’s true that babies sleep for more of the day than adults do, but they also wake up a lot more. So on average, babies sleep for 16 to 18 hours per day, but they spend about half of that time in active sleep, and the other half in quiet sleep. Babies also sleep much more on weekdays than they do on weekends!

<|prompter|>Can I substitute sour cream for cream cheese in a recipe?
<|assistant|>
suffix: I’m sorry to tell you that you can’t substitute one for the other, at least not for most recipes.  Cream cheese is a very specific type of cheese that’s very high in fat and usually used as a spread for various kinds of foods.  Sour cream is a very different type of dairy product that usually isn’t used in the same way, so you can’t really use it as a substitute in most recipes that call for cream cheese.  If you want to use sour cream instead of cream cheese, you can try doing that in recipes where it’s actually listed as an ingredient, and using it in place of cream cheese where it’s intended to be used in a slightly different way, but I would definitely recommend avoiding recipes that call for cream cheese specifically.

Necessarily, no.  Cream cheese is thickened with added cream and yogurt, while sour cream is already made using naturally sour cream cultures. In some cases, it may work fine, but in others the difference in acidity and fat content can change the taste of the dish.

suffix: A vegetarian diet is one that excludes meat and animal-based foods, such as poultry, seafood, and red meat.  There are many different types of vegetarian diets, which vary depending on what foods they do include.  A broad range of health and weight-loss benefits have been identified in vegetarian diets, including reduced risk of heart disease, lower blood pressure, reduced rates of obesity and diabetes, lower cholesterol, and lower cancer risk.  There are also many potential drawbacks of a vegetarian diet, especially if certain key nutrients or foods are not adequately replaced.  For example, a vegetarian diet may limit intake of important nutrients like protein, iron, zinc and vitamin B-12, which are typically richly present in animal-based foods.  Furthermore, inadequate calorie intake and a lack of certain important nutritional ingredients are common concerns with vegetarian diets.  The type of vegetarian diet you choose can help mitigate these issues to a large extent.

The primary positive aspect of a vegetarian diet is its potential health benefits, which can include lower risk of obesity and cardiovascular disease, as well as various other nutritional advantages.  Some research has also suggested that vegetarian diets can potentially reduce the incidence of certain types of cancer.  On the other hand, there are also a number of potential drawbacks and challenges to adopting a vegetarian diet.  These include the increased difficulty and expense of obtaining adequate nutrition from a vegetarian diet, as well as reduced dietary variety and the risk of dietary deficiencies.  In addition, a vegetarian diet can also place greater emphasis on processed foods, which carry their own health risks, and might involve relying on fortified or supplemented foods in order to obtain adequate nutrition.  Finally, there can also be important social and cultural challenges involved in adopting a vegan or vegetarian diet in some communities and societies.

prefix: <|prompter|>I get motion sickness. Will I be able to go on a cruise?

<|assistant|>Motion sickness is a common issue affecting a wide range of people. Often, motion sickness can be treated successfully, and you may still be able to enjoy a cruise. There are a number of methods of treatment and prevention of motion sickness, which can include such treatments as medication, acupressure, breathing meditation, cognitive reframing techniques, and other lifestyle changes. You should consult with a physician or other healthcare professional if your symptoms are particularly severe or long-lasting. Additionally, you can consider taking such steps as setting your body clock to the local time onboard, avoiding alcohol and spicy foods before your cruise, and eating small meals and snacks more often during the day.

Dry-sense medication (such as Phenergan) typically has few side effects, but may make you drowsy, and other types of medication (such as Scopalamine and Meclazine) may reduce the symptoms of motion sickness but are also likely to be sedating.  Additionally, one or several of the non-medicinal approaches mentioned above can also be effective as treatment or prevention methods. If your motion sickness symptoms are particularly severe or long-lasting, it might be important to consult with a physician, as you may need to try a different approach.

prefix: <|prompter|>Can you explain what a paradox is?

<|assistant|>Sure, a paradox is a contradiction or an apparent contradiction.  It’s a statement or a situation that seems to defy or violate our common sense or our intuition about the way the world works.  Philosophers basically just love paradoxes, because they show that our common sense and our intuition can be wrong, and they force us to think more deeply about the ideas involved.  A famous paradox comes from the Greek philosopher Zeno, who said that Achilles can never catch up to the tortoise, because in order to get halfway to the tortoise, he first has to get halfway to that halfway point, and then he has to get halfway to that halfway point, and so on ad infinitum.  So there’s this infinite series of halfway points that he has to get through, and becauseinfinity goes on forever, it takes him an infinite amount of time to get to the tortoise, so he’ll never reach it.  But of course we know that in reality, Achilles can easily catch up to and pass the tortoise, so this is a paradox.  It seems like our intuition about how distances and motion work in the real world is wrong.  Does that make sense?
<|prompter|>Ok I understand. Can you give me a simple yet fun paradox?

<|assistant|>Sure, one very famous paradox is the “liar paradox”.  It’s the idea that a person could say something like “I’m lying” -- so they’re obviously telling the truth, but at the same time they’re also obviously lying, so it sounds contradictory.  But the thing is, there’s really no paradox at all -- a person can truthfully say they’re lying, it’s just that it doesn’t mean what we intuitively expect it to mean.  It’s a bit tricky to understand, but once you get it it’s actually pretty fascinating.
<|prompter|>Ok, I understand that one. Can you give me a slightly more complicated one?

It goes sort of like this... imagine walking across the room, the length of the room is infinitesimally small, so you’ll obviously reach the other side very quickly.  But then imagine halving the length of the room over and over again -- at some point you have to reach a certain tiny length that’s too small to cross in a meaningful amount of time, so you should never actually be able to cross the room at all.  But of course we know that actually is easy to do.  The idea is that the paradox highlights the contradiction between the finite and the infinite, and how they somehow coexist despite seeming to be incompatible.  It’s pretty mind blowing.
